story:
Hi all, 

So the votes are in and we have started an air strike campaign in Syria.

This is allegedly our "moral" obligation. I am among the many who feel that doing something in essence immoral and wrong, can not possibly be a "moral" obligation.

I want to release a compilation in protest of this. Show us united against the "War on Terror". 


As a backer you will be showing your lack of support for the UK air strikes, and will be able to voice this with one of two awesome T-shirts and/or a great compilation CD of songs of protest. 
PS: If you're a solo artist or in a band and have suitable material, get in touch!

About the Creator

I am a soon-to-be music graduate with political interests, I am one of the many who oppose the UK's air strikes in Syria that have just been voted for. 

I am starting a risk free project to promote anti-war sentiment and show that we as a population do not wish to bomb other countries or go to war. 
The aim is to promote disarmament and peace, as opposed to what Mr. Cameron proposes. 
Also, I am apparently a "terrorist sympathiser" for disagreeing, really?

story:
This is a crowdfunding campaign to raise the production costs of making the new Nervasystem album into a limited edition physical release on CD. The funding will pay for the manufacturing costs of the discs (300) and packaging and a very small amount for publicity to get the information across the social networks. Any additional money raised above the target, if that happens will go directly to the artist and all the contributors and artists involved. This iwill be a collection of fresh psychedelic tracks from Nervasystem, and many collaborations as well, with such luminaries as Sean Williams (Process), Graham Wood (The Infinity Project), Colin Bennun (OOOD), Leigh Griffiths (E.C.T.), Ralph Knobloch (Braincell), Maor Hasbani (Skizologic), and Morison Bennett (Globular) plus another surprise guest. 

The album is detailed, sonically impressive, adventurous, original and pushes the limitatations of the electronic psy genre(s) whilst remaining musical, captivating and trippy as you like. Advanced techniques, esoteric synth wig out tech of an extraordinarily complex and seemingly mind boggled modus operandi, tales from the landscape impossible, savage and beautiful in equal measure, all iridescent and scintillating, a thing of weird beauty.

Cd is released through Voodoo Voltage Records.


Thanks go to everyone who has enjoyed and supported the music creations and thank you to all the amazing artists who bring the sounds............

Here is sonic pre-listen of some elements from the album.  https://nervasystem.bandcamp.com/album/brainrad...

story:
Hey what's up!

Hello, people, my name is Kevin David Marín Quiñonez aka KDMQ, I’m a self-taught musician from México, to be specific, from the northern part of the country, in Durango. And I want to be part of the Icelandic Airwaves Music Festival 2017. But, I need money to pay the artist fee for the submission.

As a self-taught musician, or as I call myself “Non-Artist”, I learned that you can’t get the things that you want that easy, and especially a Mexican, I need to work my self ten times harder to get or reach what I want.

The music I made is a mixture between Alternative and Experimental with a little touch of electronics and analogic instruments, such as tape recorders, pianos, ukuleles, guitar, drum machines and more.

For a long time ago I wanted to be part of a music festival, especially outside from México, and what a better festival like the “Icelandic Airwaves” in Iceland. When I discovered the festival and that it was hosted in one of my favorite places (Iceland), I dreamed about being one of the artists that would be on the line-up of something. So you can imagine my ecstasy when I discover that they accept “artist submissions”, I went like crazy to the web page and make the whole application, and to my surprise, I need to pay “20 Dollars” to send it.

So that's when you come to help me, for an artist and student as well, get 20 dollars, in México, where it's about like 600 pesos, it’s kinda hard, so please people, if you can help it would be amazing, if you can’t, you can always share this with other people.


With all of your donations you would help me to pay the “artist fee”, and get a chance to be on one of the greatest festivals ever, plus theres other ways you can help me, you can get my music in kdmq.bandcamp.com.

 

Y eso es todo.

story:
Patented technology and design December 2015

Why Indiegogo?

Any product can always be improved. We listened to your comments and took them to heart in the new design of DropShades. We started with a group of 3 college students creating a rough prototype in hopes to introduce a cool new product into the market. Though we did introduce this product to the market, we think we can do better. Our version 2.0 of DropShades takes everything you loved about the original design while making fundamental improvements to all pieces of the product. We concentrated on three substantial areas of change.

New Features

1)  Always On  Mode

DropShades now gives you the ability to choose between multiple modes of flashing or non- flashing lights. You will still have access to our patented auto-equalizing mode that translates sound across 12 light bars, but additionally DropShades now has an always on mode that allows all 12 light bars to stay illuminated while you dance the night away.

2) NEW ARM DESIGN

By strengthening the hinges and improving the way the arms wrap around your ear. While also redesigning the electronics so that the weight is better distributed across your face and the frames of the glasses. They're also15% percent lighter than the original's making them much more comfortable to wear. 

3)  NEW NOSE BRIDGE

We’ve redesigned the structure of the glasses in a way that improves the fit on your face. These changes include making adjustments to the nose bridge to fit more naturally and ergonomically.

We have enhanced DropShades ability to discern sound at higher volumes by improving the algorithm in the automatic audio sensor. To switch between them, simply just keep pushing the button until you find your ideal mode.  

 Gold is the single most requested color that we've received over the last few years, so we are making it happen. We wanted to give back to this community for helping us launch the first DropShades, so no stretch goal is required. You can get a pair of gold DropShades as soon as we launch.

Front View- Version 2

Aerial View - Version 2

Side View

 Long story short, we are a group of friends that came together to turn a cool idea into a reality; now we are here on our 2nd version to give back after listening to you and to give you an even better product. We launched our first crowd source funding campaign for DropShades in May of 2013, and were able to bring DropShades to life. The most rewarding aspect of our business is getting to hear stories of all the fun people have had with our product. Thank you for supporting us!

 REWARDS 

 

 <Check out our sick collection of Tee's>

 

Timeline

Retailers Information

If you are interested in carrying DropShades in your store (online or physical), we would love to hear from you! Get in touch with us sales@getdropshades.com

International Distributors

We're interested in talking to you about distributing our product in your country. We are particularly interested in talking to you if you are in: 

Europe- England, Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Belgium, The Netherlands, Spain, France, Serbia, Germany, Bulgaria, Switzerland, Croatia, Denmark, Iceland, Hungary, Sweden, & many more

Asia- Japan, India, South Korea

And of course. Australia

Social Networks

story:
Je m’appelle Aurélien Guitariste, compositeur, arrangeur, né en 1978 j’ ai grandi dans la banlieue est de Paris. La musique de Django Reinhardt et le Jazz en général sont le point de départ de son apprentissage musical précoce transmis par son père, mais n'est évidemment pas sa seule source d'inspiration. Élève de Pierre Cullaz, Serges Krieff, la musique de  Stevie Wonder, Michael Jackson, Marvin Gaye, la Motown en général, le funk sont des passions parrallèles à cette pression culturelle exersée sur un jeu encore infantile. Mais plus tard son éclectisme révèlera une véritable originalité dans son jeu. George Benson, Pat Martino ou Luis Salinas ont-ils nuancé le style d'Aurélien tout au long de son apprentissage, mais aussi Parker Coltrane Dizzy Milles Davis...

Ce nouveau projet est avant tout un message d'amour: aux gens que j'aime, ceux qui ont grandis - comme moi- dans les années 80, dans un HLM, derrière un écran (vert lol), la génération "touche pas à mon pote". Entre le sordide (SIDA, Héroïne...)  et l' espérance, la culture Hip-hop alors procure du rêve des couleurs sur le gris du béton. Une période plein de rêves un son en total transformation tout en gardant les valeurs « Peace and Love »  de la decénie precédente.

Ce disque est un voyage dans le temps qui traverse Les mix de Afrika Bambaataa et scratch de Grandmaster Flash, le jazz électrique, l’univers sonore des séries policières, des des jeux vidéos,  des synthétiseurs analogique, numériques FM, aux boites a rythme, le funk, du parfum de la rue de cette époque, les cages d'escaliers en béton, aux ascenseurs aux boutons brûlés par des cigarettes, au mafé, aux scooter honda en bas des immeubles, au parents qui nous hurlaient nos prénoms du haut des étages nous appelant pour manger…
Ce disque est dédier aux année 80 et tout leurs protagonistes tout style confondue.

story:
FEED TOUR ROMA

Dopo la tappa di Milano che potete vedere nel video siamo pronti a scendere nella capitale, nella città eterna, Roma

il FEED TOUR è un occasione per far risaltare youtube come strumento non fatto solo di pixel ma di esseri umani e relazioni, non serve una partita a bowling tra youtuber per parlare di youtube ma bisogna creare un luogo e un giorno dove chi ama questo argomento si possa incontrare e dialogare.

Ed infine è un buon modo per diffondere cultura digitale anche tra i meno attenti alle problematiche e alle insidie del web e valorizzare la figura del content creator.


Prima di continuare, guarda il riassunto video della tappa del FEED TOUR di Milano:


QUANDO & DOVE

Domenica 5 Luglio alle Ore 15,30 al locale "Let it Beer"
Piazza delle Crociate 26/28 - Tel.393 916 1158

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Let-It-Beer/220504948073265?fref=ts

OSPITI

  • Dellimellow - Il Più Grande Vlogger Italiano
  • Boban Pesov - Artista
  • BOB Liuzzo - Esperto di Branding e BIFOLCO PROFESSIONISTA
  • Claudio Di Biagio - Regista
  • vKlabe - Guru & Vlogger
  • Marco Cioni - Esperto di Crowdfounding

ARGOMENTI 

Presenta e Interviene - Marco Cioni

 1) Flame Art - L'Arte di Discutere On Line [dellimellow]

2) Salvini Vs Morandi & Facebook Star vs Youtuber [dellimellow]

3) La Satira sul Tubo [Boban Pesov]

4)  La Morte della Creatività [Boban Pesov]

5) un ROBOT chiamato CREATORS [BOB Liuzzo]

6) COMMENTI e CONFUSIONE [BOB Liuzzo]

7) ARGOMENTO A SORPRESA [Claudio Di Biagio]

8) ARGOMENTO A SORPRESA [Claudio di Biagio]

9) ARGOMENTO DISPONIBILE A BREVE [vKlabe]

10) ARGOMENTO DISPONIBILE A BREVE [vKlabe]

PREZZI:

Ci saranno due tipi di premi che daremo in cambio di un contributo per aiutarci a creare l'evento:

Con 12 € è compreso il posto a sedere e lo stuzzico [150 posti]

Con 9 € è compreso un posto in piedi e lo stuzzico [30 posti]

Cosa stai pagando:

- I costi di spostamento e soggiorno a Roma per Boban Pesov, BOB e Dellimellow.

- L'affitto del Locale che ospiterà l'evento e che offrirà "lo stuzzico".

- La presenza degli Ospiti che interverranno durante l'evento.

10) ARGOMENTO DISPONIBILE A BREVE [vKlabe]
    PREZZI: Ci saranno due tipi di premi che daremo in cambio di un contributo per aiutarci a creare l'evento:
Con 12 € è compreso il posto a sedere e lo stuzzico [150 posti]
Con 9 € è compreso un posto in piedi e lo stuzzico [30 posti]
Cosa stai pagando:
- I costi di spostamento e soggiorno a Roma per Boban Pesov, BOB e Dellimellow.
- L'affitto del Locale che ospiterà l'evento e che offrirà "lo stuzzico".
- La presenza degli Ospiti che interverranno durante l'evento.

story:
HELP US GET TRUMP & YOUR FAVORITE BANDS TO SHARE THE STAGE FOR THE CONCERT AND RALLY OF A LIFETIME: TRUMPSTOCK 2020!!! Make America Great Again!

KEEP AMERICA GREAT IN 2020 w/ A DAY OF TRUMP & ROCK MUSIC!
Help Donald J. Trump get RE-ELECTED in 2020 for 4 More Years! 

FUNDS WILL GO TO DEFEAT THE CORRUPT DEMOCRATS!
If You Support Us NOW, YOU CAN BUY PERKS THAT BECOME TICKETS TO THE EVENT!!!

This will allow us to convince TRUMP and our musical talent... examples below:
PLEASE HELP get the BEST TALENT to make sure EVIL CORRUPTION WON'T WIN!

BANDS & PERFORMERS : (The more support we get the more bands we can get!!!)

Kid Rock!
Ted Nugent
Metallica
Florida Georgia Line
Post Malone
Zac Brown Band
Chris Stapleton
Kanye West
Kenny Wayne Shepherd
Lynrd Skynrd
Toby Keith
Willie Nelson
KISS
Eric Church
Big & Rich
ZZ-Top
Hank WIlliams Jr.
Ozark Mountain Daredevils
Trace Adkins
Blake Shelton
Jason Aldean
and MANY More...

All funding will go to SUPPORT TRUMPSTOCK 2020 :)
(Please see our FAQ's)

We are SO GRATEFUL for your overwhelming support!

PLEASE SHARE! Help us to make this amazing event happen!

NOTE: IF we DO hit our funding goal, the funds will go to securing the talent and venue (below). If we DO NOT hit our funding goal, the funds will go to the Trump Campaign!

VENUE:

The Florida State Fairgrounds is a 325-acre indoor and outdoor complex conveniently located at the junction of I-4, I-75 and U.S. Highway 301. Indoor venues, ranging from 5,000+ to 87,000+ square feet, and vast outdoor spaces offer flexibility and versatility to meet the needs of any event. They have the location, service, and experience to make our event a complete success.

The Florida State Fairgrounds is home to the annual Florida State Fair, and Live Nation Amphitheatre. The Fairgrounds is near some of Florida’s most popular attractions, beaches, state parks, malls, and numerous hotels and restaurants. 

The Florida State Fairgrounds highlights include:

- 325-acre Complex with Indoor and Outdoor Options
- 15,000+ Lighted Parking Spaces
- 150+ Camping Spaces with Full Hook-ups
- Box Office Services
- Catering and Concessions Services
- Event Security Services
- On-site Facility Management Services
- Preferred Hotel Program
- On-site Golf Cart Rentals

Please also check out this other great event:
https://deplorapalooza.com/ on March 5-7, 2020

story:
THE PITCH AND THE STYLE :

This documentary is the first one ever made about Gary Mudbone Cooper.
It's made for you to discover an exceptional artist, musician and human being.

Who is he and where does he come from?  His youth in the hood of Baltimore. His first steps in music. How did he meet George Clinton? How did Bootsy's Rubber Band get started? What's the story behind Sly Fox, "Let's Go All The Way", first bi-racial male duo in modern music?  What relation he has with music and with all the great musicians he worked with? And on and on...
In two words: his life.

The documentary will include interviews with Mudbone, various major musicians and producers who collaborated with him. (See below in Mudbone's short biography).
There'll be some video musical archives and some Brand New Funk Footage specially made for this documentary.
Get ready for some unexpected, undoubtedly interesting and informative surprises!
This doc' will have rhythm and some serious grooves.

The visual approach will be cinematic.
Real shots,Traveling, Close-ups.
The editing will not be frenetic.
The human approach is the heart of the project: intimate, straight from the soul conversations.
I want that you feel close to Mudbone, from his story, from History.

We'll go through funk facts too.
But this is not another documentary about Funk music.
It has another point of view...
It will tell you some other stories of Funk, stories you never heard before, the "small stories" ...
It will be like looking through the key hole...

This documentary is about legacy.
(30 to 40 minutes is an approximation for the length of the documentary)

TRAILER  :

This trailer is not an extract of the documentary.
I made it just to show what the documentary will look like and some footage that has already been done.


WHY GOING INDIEGOGO ?

As you can see in the trailer, the shooting has already begun.
Personal money has been invested to go to Cincinnati to interview Bootsy Collins in his personal studio, Frankie "Kash Waddy" and Mudbone himself.
Footage length now approaching 2 hours.

We're going Indiegogo to find money to finish the documentary.
The shooting will take place in Paris, New York, Miami, Baltimore, Minneapolis and Los Angeles. In these cities, we'll try to meet great musicians and producers who worked and/or played with Mudbone (G.Clinton, D. Stewart, Larry Graham, J.Blackwell, A.Leeds, Bill Laswell etc).
In Baltimore, city where Mudbone grew up, we'll try to find memories of the past, family members, child hood friends, musicians he helped from Baltimore to enter the professional arena as well.

How much and what will the money do for the project?
$15,000 will cover everything to complete the documentary:

Shooting
- Location for camera and sound equipment.
- Plane tickets for Mudbone and David Lanzmann.
- Car rental.
- Hotel rooms.
- Food.

Post production
- Editing.
- Color correction.
- Graphic animation.
- Sound mix.

This is the strict minimum we need to complete the documentary.

GARY MUDBONE COOPER IN A FEW LINES :

Gary “Mudbone” Cooper is one of music’s few true individuals.

In today's rigidly formatted times, Gary “Mudbone” Cooper’s career has been so astonishingly varied you couldn't make it up: prominent vocalist with Parliament-Funkadelic, co-founding member of Bootsy's Rubber Band, worldwide pop star as Sly Fox, he also collaborated with Prince, Roy Ayers, Dave Stewart, Bono, Mick Jagger, Brian May, Keith Richards, Jimmy Cliff, and many others.


Back in the seventies Mudbone’s songwriting abilities were a major ingredient in the breakthrough success of Bootsy’s Rubber Band and his signature vocal style and sound added special flavor and change in Parliament-Funkadelic recordings (whose classic songs are still being sampled today, making them one of the most sampled groups in music history, second only to James Brown), and are to this day still very much in demand. Dave Stewart invited Mudbone to co-write “Freedom's Coming” for Nelson Mandela's “46664” initiative (supporting the battle against AIDS in South Africa ).


Also in collaboration with Dave Stewart and Mick Jagger, Mudbone co-wrote and performed the song “Darkness of Your Love” for the soundtrack of the movie “Alfie” (starring British sex symbol Jude Law), which became a critical success and won a Golden Globe Award. Beyoncé covered one of his co-written songs titled "I'd Rather Be With You" as “Be With You” on her Multi Platinum selling album “Dangerously In Love”. The same song was also covered by the highly successful British girls band “The Sugababes” under the title “Freak Like Me”. That same band also sampled another Mudbone song (“Let’s Go All The Way”) for their hit “Whatever Makes You Happy”. The Sly Fox hit "Let's Go All The Way" was in the movie soundtracks of one of the cinemas highest box office grossing successes "Iron Man 3" performed by British Pop Star Robbie Williams.  And to top things up it was the theme song for 2015's hottest video game of games, Grand Theft Auto 5. 
It just keeps Going All The Way !
In addition to his songwriting abilities, Mudbone’s unique vocal style is also timeless.



THE DIRECTOR / DAVID LANZMANN IN FEW LINES:

Movie Director / Editor / Producer / Musican.

This is a quick presentation of myself.                                                                                           I began making some movies (shorts) 20 years ago, that have been pretty successful, lots of prizes and festivals all around the world.
In 2005, I made my first feature Doo Wop, released in France and a few other foreign countries. Doo Wop won lots of awards too and went around the world in festivals.
It was premiered in The Cannes Film Festival, Independent movie section on May 14th 2004.
This movie is about a young music producer.
Original soundtrack include Public Enemy, Isley Brothers, Duke Ellington, Prince and others.
Here's a funky trailer, with no words, just music :

I'm now preparing a second feature to be shot late 2016 untitled :
Some of my blood.

Besides the movies, I direct fiction for French TV, did some music videos and documentaries. I worked a lot too as an editor for all types of projects.
In 2009, I was called by Prince staff to shoot his concert at Le Grand Palais in Paris, October 11th. This show has been shot with 9 cameras.
Unfortunately, as you can imagine, I can't provide any pictures or video of this work. But I have to say, it has been an extraordinary experience.

I met Gary Mudbone Cooper in 1999. We played together (I play keys) in a band called La boulette for a special event : A concert on Champs-Elysees for the New Years eve 2000 party! December 31st 1999....


DAVID LANZMANN PERSONNAL PRESENTATION :



PEACE

story:
Have you ever tried Video Diving with your GoPro or Smartphone? Don't you wish itwas better than that?

With Video Diving System you are in control.

Are you tired of holding your GoPro or Smartphone while Diving just to get those awful videos? Do you want to get the best shots or videos without worrying about dropping or losing you GoPro? I have the solution, but I can only bring this product to life with your help.

I am a Civil Engineer but diving made me an inventor. As an independent inventor, I have created and designed some products, but nothing can be done alone, so I went back to college and asked for some help. Together we redesigned the new Video Diving System; the new self-balancing stabilizer for diving cameras and accessories.

Now you can shoot videos and pictures like a professional with your GoPro, smartphone or any other two cameras together.

What is Video Diving System?

How many times have you been on a diving trip? You've got everything ready to get in the water and take the best pictures and videos ever, and when you get back out you realize the quality of the images is terrible! Out of focus, blurry, too dim, and so on.

Or maybe you need to document an underwater research job in which you had to spend a lot of money to guarantee the quality of your shots.

Not anymore! With Video Diving System you don´t need to become an octopus with a lot of free hands nor spend lots of money to get great underwater or above-the-surface shots, because now you are in control.

* Do not include GoPro bases or BC extension clip. 

How can I use it?


Video Diving System is a new, redesigned stabilizer made for us who want the best shots out of our GoPros and Smartphones. Even if you are a new diver or snorkeler, it helps improve your underwater shooting by far, even at night.


The “Creator”

Many know me as an Engineer, but few know that diving made me an Inventor.

I have always loved adventure trips and exploring, and the ocean gives these wonderful activities a whole new meaning.

Since I was young I've had the privilege of sharing adventures with friends that are ocean lovers, who taught me about fishing, sailing, and the handling of a ship with all its responsibilities and safety measures.

Thanks to these experiences I have shared trips and the ocean itself, in a way that I have never been only a spectator, but a part of it, an organizer and even the protagonist.

I've always aimed to organize and arrange my equipment in a better way, but when I tried the GoPro diving, I felt something was missing. Looking for a solution to the lack of light and steadiness is how I came to design the Video Diving System.

This process hasn't been short nor easy, but there are people that have joined the team along the way who have seen the potential of Video Diving System.

I invite you to join this project so we can turn the VDS into a wonderful and very useful reality.

Meet the team behind the Video Diving System.

The NEOS (Business Incubator) team from UTM (Universidad Tecnológica Metropolitana)

The NEOS team from UTM is a higher education Institution with social recognition, it is a model in education and academic updating for University Technicians, and in the offering of technological services in México's Southeast.

The partnering with NEOS has been of great support in the professional making of the project, goal settings and strategic approach.

Also as a strategic alliance, we have partnered with Stampi Tech, designers and producers of molds and products, they have embraced my project as one of their own and have provided all the necessary technological support to better the original idea of the Video Diving System.

Both alliances have made the original idea become a beautiful and practical reality.

Following the business plan that NEOS created for me, my team and my 9 inventions, I founded a new company called Marine Products de Mexico. This new company practices the same values I have instilled in my team for the past 15 years; honesty and innovation as a  must.

Landy, who is a Bachelor in Business Administration, has been my administrative chief for seven years, and now Laura, who recently started modeling for our videos, joined us as our graphic designer.

What is the Video Diving System?

It is a stabilizing, self-balancing device with a universal, multi-position mount for photographic and video cameras.

What benefits can I get with a VDS?

  • Low cost
  • Lightweight
  • You can attach any kind of Smartphone, photographic or video camera.
       Examples:
          Panasonic DMC-FT5
          TX30 Sony Cyber-shot
          Nikon 1 AW1       Sony Xperia Z1 (small one)       GoPro Hero 3+ Black Edition
          FujiFilm XP200
          Olympus TG-2
          Sony HDR-AS30VAction Cam
  • You can also use it with other accessories such as :
          Lighting
          Tracking and/or Navigation devices
  • It can be attached to the user providing free use of both hands and better mobility underwater
  • It can also be a safety and rescue device in land or underwater.
  • Compact size easy to carry
  • Self-balancing design


Project Schedule

After two years of work, we want to launch Video Diving System before next summer and we have a schedule to accomplish it. We already have the design of the final product but it needs to be completed.

Rewards



FAQS

Weight and measurements

650 grs / 1.43 lbs.
25.5 x 22.90 x 16.5 cms. 10” x 9” x 6 1/2”  inches.

How was the idea born?

I listened to complaints from people who dive with their GoPros

  • They didn´t have a way to secure them and they had lost them in the ocean.
  • Shots were blurry and out of focus, so they didn't use their cameras anymore.
  • They never knew where they were shooting since they don't have a screen.

As an Engineer, I decided to solve those problems and I hurried to do so, to design and create a stabilizing base that was safe and easy to use for the camera, where my flashlight can guide my shooting.

What problems does it fix?

The lack of stability and lighting.

Now with VDS you will remember exactly your great adventures in the vast ocean thanks to clear and sharp pictures and videos.

What benefits can I get out of the VDS?

Thanks to its design, this self-balancing stabilizer, holds two cameras, flashlights and accessories in a way you've never seen before. It's a low cost frame with several benefits such as: free use of hands while diving, two-hand steady shooting, it stands by itself for selfies and you can get those nice pics of your buddies without mask shadows on their faces thanks to the steady flashlight mount.

What  kind of camera can it hold and howe many?

Any kind of camera, Smartphone or video camera, and it can hold up to three cameras at a time so you can become the explorer you've always wanted to be.

How does the VDS help me?

  1. Hands-free fastener, so you can
  2. Two-hand frame improves stability while shooting.
  3. The pendulum design with the flashlight’s weight under it, keeps it vertical and helps shooting.
  4. Your flashlight and camera aim at the same spot, so you always know what you are shooting.

Why only one flashlight and not two like the pros?

The function of the main flashlight is to help avoid shadows.

A professional team uses crossed flashlights focusing on the object between them, this is for expert photographers. When you reach that level, VDS is prepared to hold multiple additional flashlights.

Can I choose the color?
Only blue for now.

Are you using recycled materials?
No, since it is a device designed for marine use, we need the best quality.

Does it have a warranty?
Yes, one year warranty against any factory defects.

Where can I get one now?
Only through indiegogo.com

Risks and challenges

  • Build trust in fund providers to assure them that I will deliver, as promised from México.
  • Although it has passed all tests in open water and in cenotes, it is still a project design with the best intentions and a new challenge.
  • We have an excellent seaport 40 km. from the factory to ship to the world, but we still have to adjust details regarding permits.
  • The time required to manufacture injection molds to perfection, along with the supply of materials.
  • We want the best-quality materials, therefore, there can be adjustments made in order to guarantee what you will have in your hands.
  • Get our facilities ready to pack, label and ship packages per Country and region. We've made a contract with FedEx, but we are not exempt from having a shipping inconvenience.
  • It won't be easy to deliver this message to the diving population that have suffered from the lack  of lighting and stability of their GoPros, but with your help we will reach our goal.

Whats next?

If the fund-raising goals are met, we will give the final touches to the product and business plan, as well as linking our distribution channels to ensure every fund provider gets their VDS on time and with the quality promised. We will also continue improving the device.

Why the name Oshan and the Manta Ray?

As an Inventor I have various products and accessories related to diving, I felt the need to look for an identity that would describe and identify me. Before getting certified as a diver I tried an immersion with an Aqua-lung in a tank full of Rays and I didn't feel comfortable, but when I started diving and I ran into the magnificence of my first giant Ray in freedom, I knew that's how I wanted to feel underwater. When I got together with the NEOS image team, they asked me to describe what I wanted as identity and they came up with this awesome logo that identifies me.

Stretch goal

$70,000 Buoyancy valve.

Most of the money needed on this project is to build special piped modeling, so Video Diving System will work with some floatability capacity so you can adjust to neutral buoyancy on each immersion, to make an even better experience when Video Diving.

$100,000 Color selection: Blue, Fucshia, Yellow or Black.

Because life is full in colors, vote for one additional color and we try make it on the same goal.

The NEOS team from UTM is a higher education Institution with social recognition, it is a model in education and academic updating for University Technicians, and in the offering of technological services in México's Southeast.
The partnering with NEOS has been of great support in the professional making of the project, goal settings and strategic approach.
Also as a strategic alliance, we have partnered with Stampi Tech, designers and producers of molds and products, they have embraced my project as one of their own and have provided all the necessary technological support to better the original idea of the Video Diving System.
Both alliances have made the original idea become a beautiful and practical reality.

Following the business plan that NEOS created for me, my team and my 9 inventions, I founded a new company called Marine Products de Mexico. This new company practices the same values I have instilled in my team for the past 15 years; honesty and innovation as a  must.
Landy, who is a Bachelor in Business Administration, has been my administrative chief for seven years, and now Laura, who recently started modeling for our videos, joined us as our graphic designer.

What is the Video Diving System?

It is a stabilizing, self-balancing device with a universal, multi-position mount for photographic and video cameras.
What benefits can I get with a VDS?

Low cost
Lightweight
You can attach any kind of Smartphone, photographic or video camera.
			   Examples:
			      Panasonic DMC-FT5
			      TX30 Sony Cyber-shot
			      Nikon 1 AW1
			      Sony Xperia Z1 (small one)
			      GoPro Hero 3+ Black Edition
			      FujiFilm XP200
			      Olympus TG-2
			      Sony HDR-AS30VAction Cam
		
You can also use it with other accessories such as :
			      Lighting
			      Tracking and/or Navigation devices
		
It can be attached to the user providing free use of both hands and better mobility underwater
It can also be a safety and rescue device in land or underwater.
Compact size easy to carry
Self-balancing design




Project Schedule
After two years of work, we want to launch Video Diving System before next summer and we have a schedule to accomplish it. We already have the design
of the final product but it needs to be completed.

Rewards




FAQS

Weight and measurements
650 grs / 1.43 lbs.
		25.5 x 22.90 x 16.5 cms. 10” x 9” x 6 1/2”  inches.
How was the idea born?
I listened to complaints from people who dive with their GoPros

They didn´t have a way to secure them and they had lost them in the ocean.
Shots were blurry and out of focus, so they didn't use their cameras anymore.
They never knew where they were shooting since they don't have a screen.

As an Engineer, I decided to solve those problems and I hurried to do so, to design and create a stabilizing base that was safe and easy to use for the camera, where my flashlight can guide my shooting.
What problems does it fix?

The lack of stability and lighting.
Now with VDS you will remember exactly your great adventures in the vast ocean thanks to clear and sharp pictures and videos.
What benefits can I get out of the VDS?
Thanks to its design, this self-balancing stabilizer, holds two cameras, flashlights and accessories in a way you've never seen before. It's a low cost frame with several benefits such as: free use of hands while diving, two-hand steady shooting, it stands by itself for selfies and you can get those nice pics of your buddies without mask shadows on their faces thanks to the steady flashlight mount.
What  kind of camera can it hold and howe many?
Any kind of camera, Smartphone or video camera, and it can hold up to three cameras at a time so you can become the explorer you've always wanted to be.
How does the VDS help me?


Hands-free fastener, so you can 
Two-hand frame improves stability while shooting.
The pendulum design with the flashlight’s weight under it, keeps it vertical and helps shooting.
Your flashlight and camera aim at the same spot, so you always know what you are shooting.

Why only one flashlight and not two like the pros?

The function of the main flashlight is to help avoid shadows.
A professional team uses crossed flashlights focusing on the object between them, this is for expert photographers. When you reach that level, VDS is prepared to hold multiple additional flashlights.
Can I choose the color?
Only blue for now.
Are you using recycled materials?
No, since it is a device designed for marine use, we need the best quality.
Does it have a warranty?
Yes, one year warranty against any factory defects.
Where can I get one now?
Only through indiegogo.com
Risks and challenges

Build trust in fund providers to assure them that I will deliver, as promised from México.
Although it has passed all tests in open water and in cenotes, it is still a project design with the best intentions and a new challenge.
We have an excellent seaport 40 km. from the factory to ship to the world, but we still have to adjust details regarding permits.
The time required to manufacture injection molds to perfection, along with the supply of materials.
We want the best-quality materials, therefore, there can be adjustments made in order to guarantee what you will have in your hands.
Get our facilities ready to pack, label and ship packages per Country and region. We've made a contract with FedEx, but we are not exempt from having a shipping inconvenience.
It won't be easy to deliver this message to the diving population that have suffered from the lack  of lighting and stability of their GoPros, but with your help we will reach our goal.

Whats next?
If the fund-raising goals are met, we will give the final touches to the product and business plan, as well as linking our distribution channels to ensure every fund provider gets their VDS on time and with the quality promised. We will also continue improving the device.
Why the name Oshan and the Manta Ray?
As an Inventor I have various products and accessories related to diving, I felt the need to look for an identity that would describe and identify me. Before getting certified as a diver I tried an immersion with an Aqua-lung in a tank full of Rays and I didn't feel comfortable, but when I started diving and I ran into the magnificence of my first giant Ray in freedom, I knew that's how I wanted to feel underwater. When I got together with the NEOS image team, they asked me to describe what I wanted as identity and they came up with this awesome logo that identifies me.
Stretch goal
$70,000 Buoyancy valve.
Most of the money needed on this project is to build special piped modeling, so Video Diving System will work with some floatability capacity so you  can adjust to neutral buoyancy on each immersion, to make an even better experience when Video Diving.
$100,000 Color selection: Blue, Fucshia, Yellow or Black.
Because life is full in colors, vote for one additional color and we try make it on the same goal.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
On New Year's Eve in 1913, a poor boy from New Orleans fired a pistol into the air, was arrested and sent to reform school. There he was introduced to the cornet and would go on to become one of the most influential musicians of the 20th century. This is the story of Louis Armstrong,  MOTI’s muse and patron saint!

Music on the Inside, Inc. (MOTI) was created to fulfill the urgent need to give those incarcerated today the inspiring role models, skills and encouragement through music that Armstrong had.

Our belief is that music has an important role to play in restorative justice,  reducing recidivism, improving personal morale, and lowering the financial and social costs of current criminal justice.

With your support, MOTI can meet the demand for music and mentorships in more and more of our jails and prisons. 

We wish all a happy and healthy new year full of music and hope!

story:
CAZIMI EP/ALBUM

10 years into my Peruivan adventure there is still music flowing out of the desert and the jungle.

CAZIMI is an astrological term to describe the moment when a planet is in exact alignment with the centre of the sun. Connected to the central life force of our galaxy. 

This new album is happening in collaboration with Marcus Ross and Luke Matthews, two producers who are greatly assisting me to take the sounds to a more elevated place that truly captures the spirit of these tracks. 

Those of you who know me, know that all I do is connected to the path of healing with nature. These songs, this music is medicine and it's evolving. THANKS TO ALL who continue to support this expansion of good vibrations. 

EP/ALBUM/MUSIC VIDEOS

The Money Raised will go towards 

  • Session musicians for completing the Album 
  • Final mix and mastering 
  • Album Art 
  • 2 music videos from the Album 
  • 2 music videos from the Ep 

As I mostly live and work in Peru it has been difficult at times to collaborate and to bring this project to completion. However with a lot of patience and dedication I am excited to hear already the quality of what we are giving birth to. 

I will be touring again in the summer and hope to see many of your smiling faces again.

MUCH LOVE AND THANKS  From the Heart of The Sun 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Use  Indiegogo share tools! AND SHARE THIS PAGE

story:
Summary

For those who are just now being introduced to me, I’ve been singing and performing since I was 7 years old. I started in the church, but grew up around country music and quickly found my passion there. I had amazing role models to look up to, the women of the 90’s (Martina McBride, Faith Hill, Trisha Yearwood, Jo Dee Messina, Jamie O’Neal, etc.) Growing up listening to these women made me believe I could follow my dream just like they did. One of my main goals in my own music career is to inspire other young girls of today, like I was inspired back then.

Over the last 2 years, I’ve been working hard on my songwriting and recording songs I truly believe in. For the first time, unlike past albums I’ve released, I am a part of writing every song on this new album. You’re Gonna Know My Name, the title cut of the record, tells listeners that no matter the struggles I have to face as an independent female artist, and no matter the heartbreaks that this business can dish out, I’m going to keep working as hard as I can to break through, because this is what I truly love. My hope is also that it inspires others chasing their dreams to also not give up and keep pushing past barriers no matter what.

 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $50,000. This amount will cover four main categories:

(1) The recording, production, design, packaging, and manufacturing of the record

(2) Both Texas and national promotions

(3) New merchandise design and displays

(4) Touring equipment

I have created some very unique perks for my backers! These come in the form of exclusive packages that allow individuals to choose the level of support they wish to contribute. The greater the backing, the greater the perk! Every contributor will receive a copy of the brand new album, and as the levels go up, other things such as a choice between 8 different t-shirt designs, autographed photos, custom koozies, and more are available! At the higher levels of backing, I am offering personal house concerts, recognition on my website and socials, and co-branding opportunities for corporate or local businesses!

If we don’t reach the entire $50,000 goal, I plan on using whatever amount we raise towards the chronological order of the categories I listed above (i.e., the recording will be covered first, then manufacturing, then promotions, etc.).

 

The Impact

It is really difficult to succeed as an independent female artist in Texas. I’ve been so blessed to have had a lot of encouragement and support along the way, for which I’m so grateful, but even so, I STILL encounter roadblocks and glass ceilings on a daily basis with things like booking venues and festivals, getting my songs played, and getting fair opportunities.

That being said, over the last 6 years, I’ve given my everything to my music career, but I am now at a crossroads. I need your help, or I might have to consider looking into things that take me away from music full-time. Your contribution at any level means that I can continue on my God-given path.

I am confident that this new album can be a turning point for me because I saw immense growth in my career with my debut album, Steel (2017). From that album, I won numerous awards, had several successful singles on Texas radio, had a profitable and busy tour schedule, and was headed on an upward trajectory (check out the bio section of my website, www.hollytucker.com for more info). Because of some unfortunate contractual obligations, my career was put on hold for about a year, which really stalled my progress. With your help releasing this new music, I’ll be able to reach new audiences, and grow my brand even bigger than before.

 

Risks & Challenges

An independent artist’s biggest challenge is finding and/or creating constant financial support. This is usually where a record label comes in. Nowadays, independent artists can be their own record label. The main “pro” to this is owning the rights and materials to everything (publishing, recordings, tour and merchandise sales, etc. minus expenses). With the release of this new music, I’ll be able to create more media hype, book more gigs, and grow the brand, without having to give a percentage of it to a label.

Another big challenge I face is overcoming the hurdles that come with being a female artist today. They say females have “less ticket and merch sales, less radio play, less impact on a wider audience”. The only way to combat this is to constantly be putting out the best music I possibly can, keeping people interested and sharing my content, and engaging with my fans on a personal level, which I will continue to do.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and I understand! But here are some other ways to help:

  • Make some NOISE about my campaign!! Use the Indiegogo share tools to share with friends and family via email and/or social media
  • PRAY. Lift this campaign up in your time with God and ask Him for His will to be done!

story:
Short Summary

This project was done mainly to help Folktek Mescaline semimodular synth integrate better with eurorack format. 

Some (not all) uses with Folktek Mescaline:

1. Send envelopes to Channel for full control (envelope into Key) of the unit. Also allows for much shorter sounds. Chords, or melodies - now fully sequencable.

2. Send gates and trigs directly into Mental - sometimes you don't want to mess with motion too much.

3. Send trigs from motion to your eurorack - sometimes you want motion to be the main sequencer.

4. Add & Remove Motion pulses now can be tied to joystick or manual gate, or sequenced. 

And many, many more. 

Specs:

  • Passive
  • Unipolar 0-10v
  • Protected from -7 to +17v 
  • 6hp
  • Common ground
  • 20mm depth

 

FAQ

Why is it so pricy for passive format converter?

I do not do it by hand - I hired professional company to design & produce the unit. They have their own markup on this. It looks decent enough and aesthetics take part of the price too. Getting it from 8 hp to 6 hp turned out to be a bit more $. Add taxes (18% from profit, 23% VAT), packaging, time spent to pack & send everything and suddenly the initial price doubles T_T.

Why unipolar?

Because it covers 90% of cases, and makes it cheaper.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • No risks - Prototype is ready for production & tested.

story:
dSteven's First Album!

I’m very excited to announce that I have released my first full album and have also released the very first single on the radio called “Turning Me On” which is now climbing the Independent charts! My music has gotten the attention of artists such as the Queen of Soul, the late great Aretha Franklin. We were on the verge of working together before her advancing illness and other responsibilities took priority. I was a part of the national recording artist 7 Sons of Soul on the Verity/Zomba Gospel label and have shared the stage with many artists and written music on various projects.

I’m doing an Indiegogo campaign to meet the costs of this project, including my first video for “Turning Me On”. This means you can be a part of this exciting experience. If you choose to contribute you'll receive the album and you can take part of various reward options such as autographed pictures, t-shirts and stainless steel water bottles, opportunities for me to perform at your next event and more! I hope that you will consider supporting me and I appreciate you in advance.

 

The Impact

Your contribution will be integral in the success of this album and the singles that are released. There are many costs associated with producing this album such as:

Recording costs which include studio time, engineers, musicians, mixing and mastering

Promotional costs such as radio, press release newswire services, print and internet campaigns

Photo/video shoots

All of this will costs between $7,500-$10,000 and I have already invested approximately $5,000.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you unable to support financially, you could be a huge help in the following ways:

Follow me on social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and YouTube @ dStevenSoul)

Sign up for my mailing list

Share this campaign and let people know

However you're able to contribute would be very much appreciated!

story:
Music of My Soul Album

I am so moved to be writing this – my 25th anniversary of musical performances that included some of the best stages in the world (details below)

This anniversary was celebrated in a two-concert series in Miami Beach (The Fillmore Miami Beach at Jackie Gleason Theater for 2500 sold-out show) and Los Angeles (Saban Theater in Beverly Hills for 2400 sold-out show) and now is the moment to commemorate my music in an anniversary album, titled Music of My Soul. 

Just like the name suggests, this album is very dear to my heart and soul, it is a combination of everything that I love about music, all the genres I have composed in and performed; jazz, soul, pop, Latin music, French music, and European music in both instrumentals and with lyrics. Every song on this album is a mix of who I am. 

I hope you love listening to the songs, as much as I loved composing and writing, and, of course, performing them. 

By taking a part in this album, you become my co-creator for every step of the way. Your name will be in the album, and your support of the recording and production of this milestone in my career, will last forever, for as long as there’s music listeners. 

 

The 10 songs in the album are handpicked and will be crafted to perfection with your help. 

Please see some of the talented artists you will be co-creating this album with:

GRAMMY® award winner, Alan Silverman, production

Michael Lington, Saxophone  

Michaelangelo, vocals

Alejandro Irizarry, vocals

Nuno Resende, vocals

Julio Iglesias Jr., vocals

GRAMMY® nominated Jessyca Sarango, lyrics 

Natahsa Kertes, photography

 

And… you!

You will be an important part of this album.

 

$13,000 – musicians and vocalists

$7,000 – arranging, recording, engineering, mixing, mastering, studio time, etc’

$2000 – Marketing: advertising and promotion for the album, radio, TV, social media, YouTube, photoshoot, etc’

$2000 – publishing, registration, copyright, etc’

$1000 – instruments for recording, rentals, etc’

 

Part of this album is already ready – but I am not able to cover all expenses to complete it. I hope that everything will be completed by June 2020! 

Every cent of your money will go towards perfecting this album, and as co-creators you will get something back with every contribution you give:

Elena Iorova’s Latest performances

The Fillmore Miami Beach at Jackie Gleason Theater Miami Beach, FL, USA

Saban Theater in Los Angeles, CA, USA

World Jazz Festival in Riga, Latvia (https://youtu.be/ngcjBJNGnhw)

House of Music, Moscow, Russia (https://youtu.be/9rR0ZxmlA_U?t=32)

Jazz Club, Moscow, Russia (https://youtu.be/FoOa7wbrBrE)

Premier of the song En Tu Piel (https://youtu.be/b0QZF1OUATg)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

This anniversary was celebrated in a two-concert series in Miami Beach (The Fillmore Miami Beach at Jackie Gleason Theater for 2500 sold-out show) and Los Angeles (Saban Theater in Beverly Hills for 2400 sold-out show) and now is the moment to commemorate my music in an anniversary album, titled Music of My Soul.

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • I am a professional blues artist and I dedicated my whole live to my music. I play guitar from the age of six. Blues is my passion, my first motivation and the reason why I want to move to Portland
  • We need help for our upcoming promotional tour and to print the new record 
  • If you want to deserve the blues like us You are the right people to help us.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need help to renting a van, to pay one booking agency 
  • That band sounds amazing, we play the real blues!

The Impact

Any little help is really important to us:

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share our campaing as much as you can using the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU VERY MUCH LOVE YOU GUYS

story:
My Story

Hey everyone! My name is James Carter, and I am a singer, song writer, producer & pianist based in Sydney, Australia! My story is a bit different... I didn't start leaning piano until I was 17 so I had some serious catch up to do! I left school with a dream and a vision to create soulful music and 2018 to make that dream a reality. I have dedictaed the last 10 years of my life to reaching the point in my career where I am ready to record. Music is my life & I have sacrificed a lot to get where I am today. 

I am excited to take you on this crazy but beautiful journey with me. Recently I have been working away & am currently working on my orginial 5 track EP, that's at the refining point of arrangement and lyrics! The sound is a mixture between Pop and rock with elements from the late 60's to 70's. My inspiration draws from the likes of Ray Charles, The Rolling Stones, INXS, Elton John, Led Zeppelin, David Bowie and Pink Floyd. 

It is a collaboration where I will been working with top producers/co-writers and I am so stocked to be at this stage. They are super close to being ready to record & this is where this campaign will hopefully help me change my life. I would love to share some of these tracks with you & chat with you all of the meaning and stories behind the lyrics and music. 

What We Need & What You Get

If we're able to raise the big 25k! We will be able to make a 5-song EP! Even the smallest contribution will mean the world to me & get me closer to my goal. Here's a breakdown of the costs involved. If we raise over the target, the money will go into filming and further marketing. 

Recording Costs $15,000

  • Studio rental 
  • Hired musicians 
  • Sound engineer 
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Producer fees
  • Vocal production fees 

Branding/Packaging $8000

  • Visual packaging (EP artwork + 4 singles artwork + album design & liner notes) 
  • Cover artwork for 5 singles
  • Cover artwork for EP 
  • Photo shoots - digital promo, marketing, website
  • Website design 

Marketing & PR Costs $2000

  • Digital marketing 
  • Blog Outreach 
  • PR services in Australia/US/Europe 

Payment processing fees (~3% of total)

IndieGoGo's platform fees (5% of total) 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to make a contribution just yet, have no fear! You can still help me out by spreading the word on social media AND follow my work (& some surfing at Bondi beach) on my Instagram @withjamescarter

story:
I'm a singer and songwriter.

picture by Chancelor Humphrey

My latest project 'Possibilities' was produced sonically and visually by my friend Shuffle Jack. It took us years to make without even meeting in person or conversing. I guess the music made us relate in its own way so when we actually met, it made the collection of songs we crafted more special to us. Thats why I want to do something to etch it in stone so to speak. And what better way to do that than with vinyl.

You can check the project here. Its also streaming on Spotify, Itunes, tidal and everywhere there is streaming also. 

Basically, I want press up 100 limited edition records with cover and full color printing. The ground level cost for this with no add ons is about $1600  The breakdown is this:

Black Vinyl with two color center label - $1005.00
Record Jackects with full color printing - $495.00
Polylined Innersleeves - $20.00
Test Cut - $40.00
Shrinkwrap - $20.00

For those that give anything, I am extremely, extremely thankful and grateful. For those that give $20 you will be blessed with a fresh copy of the album hot off the press and mailed to your door with free shipping!

Lets make it happen!

story:
Who are we?

Hi. This is Billy and Juliet and we go by the name memoryfield. We've been writing, recording, and performing music since we were teenagers and, as a duo, since 1992.  We've lived and worked in very diverse places such as the "Live Music Capital of the World" Austin, Texas, and beautiful Missoula, Montana.  Now, we're based in Provo, Utah, with towering mountains in our backyard. 

What do we sound like?

Rock, hard rock, progressive mood-rock, folky, jazzy... these are just a few of the labels and genres that have been used to describe our sound over the years. We're cool with that, because we've been inspired by so many different musical sounds and artistic legends.  In addition to our original material, we've covered The Who, David Bowie, The Smiths, The Sundays... just to name a few.  Even "Dream On" by Aerosmith.  We don't limit ourselves just to fit neatly into musical "boxes".  We write and record in ways that inspire and challenge us, always trying to stay a step ahead of where we were yesterday. 

Here is what we look and sound like in 2015:

Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo campaign page.  Now that you know who we are we should tell you exactly what we want to do.   

What is our goal?

Very simple, really.  We just want to design an awesome T-shirt for you. First and foremost, we are musicians and our passion is to create music. But in addition, we would like our music to reach a broader audience, and we believe that these great-looking T-shirts can help us do that.

Here is the design.  As of now, these are the only two shirts that have been made.  We have a women's design and a men's design. We would LOVE to create hundreds more just like these, and that’s where we need your help. By ordering a T-shirt or two or three (see the options to your right), we can reach our goal of $4400 and make and ship yours to you ASAP.

Juliet is 5' 1" and is wearing a Medium. (Female sizes run small)

Billy is 5’8” and sporting an XL size.

How can you help? 

We would love for you to order an official memoryfield T-shirt for $22, which includes all shipping costs. These are high-quality, 100% cotton shirts using state-of-the-art screening technology in heather navy blue. We have several purchasing options under the “PERKS” list to your right. And if you would rather just get two of our recordings, we have Mp3 download cards for $2. That’s fantastic as well.  But if you buy a shirt, we'll throw in the download cards for each shirt purchased.  So, go for the shirt.  (It’s a sweeter deal!)   The easiest way to make a simple pledge is to click directly on one of the "perk" boxes and just skip right over the initial pledge for $ section.  Go right for the "perks" that you want.  We'll ask you for shirt sizes and things after the campaign has ended.

Very Important:  Remember, when you make a pledge you will be charged by PayPal for that pledge.  If the campaign for some reason fails to meet the 30-day goal of $4400 then you will be immediately refunded by PayPal.  But when the campaign succeeds, the shirts will be printed and sent to you as soon as they are made.  That's how it works!

And finally, you can also help memoryfield by simply hitting the “SHARE” button. Please share this campaign page with as many people as you can.  Because short of that, we just won’t reach enough people on our own without resorting to dropping hundreds of dollars into Internet advertising. Indiegogo provides sharing links on the left of the page.

Thank you so much for your time and we hope to hear from you soon. Now, enough of all that!  Click on “Gallery” at the top to see more memoryfield photos and YouTube videos.

story:
Summary

I've got an idea about putting a collection of tracks together and getting them pressed on 12 inch vinyl. You get your copies and whats left behind will be sent  to some specific music biz people. The more money donated, the more copies, the more exposure, which will hopefully benefit everyone involved better. So I was gonna see if you want to get involved and either be on it or donate to someone you know who's on it? I've explained pretty much everything in the video above so please take a look.

What We Need & What You Get

Hoping that all artists will contribute at least a tenner, the more you contribute the more copies you'll get back. But for a minimum £10 you’d get a copy possibly more depending on how successful the funding is. Min overall target would be £540 for 100 white labels. £600 would get 300. These prices include VAT. If the target is passed by £50-£200 then labels and artwork could also be produced. Also, the more artists on it, the more friends and family there will be to potentially donate. 
Artists/Bands Interested at the moment include:
  • Vogue Noir
  • Tim Weary/The Weary Band
  • Dayward
  • Pepi's a vandal
  • Commuter Love
  • Mark Day
  • DJ Gils
  • The Air Gap
  • A+M

The Impact

So it’s not a profit thing - I don’t want to sell them, just use it as an awareness campaign as I think music biz people would be intrigued to get a vinyl, especially as its making a comeback. I'll be aiming to get some copies out to radio and music blogs amongst other tastemakers. There may also be opportunities to licence the music to advertising, tv, film, corporate videos etc.

Risks & Challenges

If we don't hit the minimum £540 mark then we can't really go ahead into production, thats why I'm going to use the fixed campaign as opposed to flexible. Fixed is where its all or nothing, flexible - you get to keep whats donated but I'd have your obligations to produce the vinyl. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! its a great idea. No one loses out and you have a 12 inch vinyl to play and play till the cows come home or you could use it to promote yourself... or you could just keep it to show the grandchildren.

story:
This is Daniel Guerra from Denali West Coast. In 2013 we formed a partnership with DJ Harrison, the prodigiously talented producer and multi-instrumentalist based in Richmond, VA. Since then we have organized and embarked on six short west coast tours, stretching from Los Angeles to Seattle. Over the course of these tours DJ Harrison has performed at Boiler Room, Delicious Vinyl, Beat Cinema, Brick and Mortar, The Honey Hive Gallery and Stop Biting. In addition to these concerts he has appeared on the critically acclaimed Soulection, opened up for the legendary DJ Shadow, and performed at a Stones Throw Records event at SXSW in 2015, all while releasing numerous stellar mixtapes and albums. 

While six tours in three years is no small feat, we believe that DJ Harrison needs to be on the west coast more frequently so we can continue to expand his fanbase in this specific region of the country. Six short tours spread over three years is not enough to accomplish that goal. Therefore, I have decided to ask you for your support so we can organize and execute three DJ Harrison tours in 2016 on the west coast. 

We are not alone in thinking that he needs to be out here more often. Indeed, many of you have sent Denali West Coast several emails and messages, wondering when he would return. Some of you has also asked when he would be coming to your city, and not just Los Angeles, San Francisco or Seattle. Your support will enable us to continue to book shows in our old stomping grounds while allowing us to expand to new cities, such as San Diego, Sacramento, Eugene, Portland and Bellingham. In addition to performing in new cities, your support will help us create longer tours that provide you and your friends with even more opportunities to catch DJ Harrison live.

All of the funds that we raise will go towards the operating costs of touring : airfare , gas , car rentals, the occasional hotel room or airbnb, food and new merchandise. Even if we do not reach our goal, every penny will still go towards these specific costs. 

We have a number of incredible perks for our backers, which includes but is not limited to concert tickets, DJ Harrison t-shirts that are only available through this campaign, unreleased tracks and private concerts. 

If you are unable to contribute any funds, you can still let your friends and family know about the campaign and share it on social media. Every bit of help is much appreciated. 

 Please feel free to hit me up with any questions or concerns you may have at denalibooking@gmail.com. Thank you kindly for checking out our campaign and we look forward to seeing you at a show on the west coast soon.

Even if we do not reach our goal, every penny will still go towards these specific costs. We have a number of incredible perks for our backers, which includes but is not limited to concert tickets, DJ Harrison t-shirts that are only available through this campaign, unreleased tracks and private concerts. If you are unable to contribute any funds, you can still let your friends and family know about the campaign and share it on social media. Every bit of help is much appreciated.  Please feel free to hit me up with any questions or concerns you may have at denalibooking@gmail.com. Thank you kindly for checking out our campaign and we look forward to seeing you at a show on the west coast soon.

story:
Click here to view an excellent article on defamation and why it's my only option.

Rayne Peck has contentiously spread lies about things I did not do, she has used false screen shots to create a false fear about me. Upon me bringing the seriousness of these allegations to light the girl who previously posted edit screen shots has added this to her original post.

Rayne Peck from the UK is a cyber bully, she is continuously trying to destroy my life via attacks ever the internet. i did not do anything to warrant this. All I'm asking is for the chance to prove everything I'm saying in court.

Since starting this campaign, many of the girls Rayne tried to use to prove her claims have come out saying never harassed them and they they arnt under aged.


My Story               (Please watch video first)

One day you're sitting there living your dreams, finally seeing 7 years of blood, sweat and tears pay off. Suddenly you get a direct message accusing you of horrible things based off a rumor. Then within 3 days, your life is demolished by false allegations presented with no proof and you're alone and broke in a foreign country. Apparently it's all guilty until proven innocent now.

My name is Austin Kerr, formerly of the band Set It Off. I'm sure this will fall on mostly deaf ears, but I'm really hoping shitily made video can help me set the story straight and can help me get my life back after it was destroyed by lies or at least make my dreams again possible.

Help me to sue the following woman for defamation. They put out false allegations, lied, edited, twisted the truth and led a charge of thousands of people who attacked, physically threatened me and caused the loss of my career.
Rayne P***      J********     Kate Car******

J******* has been removed from this suit because she has publicly stated I have never sexually harassed her.

Sexual Harassment is: unwanted sexual advances. That means it has to be (A) A Sexual Advance: Gestures made towards another person with the aim of gaining some sort of sexual favor or gratification and (B) Unwanted.

Especially when referring to outside of a work place. Something becomes legally “unwanted” when that is expressed as such.

I did not do this to Rayne, her allegations are lies. she has circumvented the legal system and my legal rights in order to ruin everything i ever had.

Neither of these circumstances exist. Yet Rayne has continued to use this wording in order to harm me.

ALL IM HOPING TO GET OUT OF ALL OF THIS IS A PIECE OF PAPER SAYING I WAS RECUSED, A RETRACTION OF THE ALLEGATIONS OR AN APOLOGY. JUST SOMETHING SO WHEN THIS GETS BROUGHT UP IN WHATEVER I DO NEXT I CAN SAY IT WAS UNTRUE, HERE'S THE DOCUMENT.

ABSOLUTELY NO DONATIONS WILL GO INTO MY POCKET.
ALL PREOCEEDS OF THE CASE WILL BE DONATED TO RAINN.ORG (TO HELP ACTUAL SEXUAL HARASSMENT VICTUMS) AND
CYBERSMILE.ORG (TO PREVENT FURTHER CYBER BULLYING)

These are the type of posts that ended my career

This is what was posted on her blog as proof of "an underage victim"

I was just messaged by someone who knows first hand that Rayne spreads lies

This is an example of the alleged "victims" and proof of the fear mongering done by Rayne. This is why when people say "so many victims" I ask for one proven instance.


The Truth Is...

I was accused of disgusting horrible things that I honestly just didn't do.  I'm not saying I'm perfect, in fact I've learned how extremely considerate and careful you have to be with not only the people you interact with but onlookers as well. For instance what flirting with a short 20 year old female might look like to someone at the other side of a venue or how jokingly saying someone is lame can cause emotional damage. I’m honestly so sorry for those situations and I wish I was told at the time I had offended or hurt anyone so I could have made it right.

I've been asked this a few times so I will say this clearly here. Not one of these woman ever approached me or anyone in my former band about any of these matters or accusations at any time, yes I asked. The first I heard of any of this was when people started posting this stuff to the internet. I have not been able get in contact with any of them since they blocked or ignored any attempt to communicate, or handle any of this. so the only option is legal.  I believe if someone is going to accuse you of crimes, You should be given the right to face your accuser. Especially if it ruins your life.

Unfortunately it costs at least $15,000 dollars just to start the journey back to once again being able to go out into the world without being attacked. If I don't defend myself against false accusations I open myself up to being accused of anything. Currently these girls could say I beat someone or robbed someone and it probably would be believed as well.

Just because I'm broke shouldn't mean I can't defend myself.

The Problem With Defamation...

I can honestly say this has been the worst two months of my life. Within the first two weeks of being home I spoke with many lawyers and found out that while I can prove in a court of law that the only crime I've committed is offering alcohol to people under 21. Unfortunately it would take thousands of dollars to be given the chance (which I've been trying to save up for). After getting help to recover from heavy depression and some suicidal situations, a friend brought up crowd funding possible solution.

I have no idea if this will work, but I have to try and regardless I'll still be saving up.

Please help me to clear my name, stop being attacked, and make my dreams possible again.

Thank you
Austin Kerr


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant or wont help I understand, but Id appreciate if you would tell a friend.

  • Word of mouth can go along way
  • a tweet, fb post or tumblr post can go a long way too


LAST NOTE

I hope anyone who reads this can understand that you have the right to your voice, if you ever feel uncomfortable to you have right to speak to that person or their seniors.(though that doesn’t mean that person is actively doing something against you) Most people will stop an action immediately if you ask them to. All phones have recording functions on them and we all know how to take screen shots. If you feel uncomfortable, tell that person. If a situation persists. It is very easy to gain proof this way and take action with higher authorities.

However nobody has the right to publicly accuse someone of anything, this is generally referred to as defamation and a witch hunt. There is a law system in place. Going to a social worker first can greatly help with the stress of the process.

story:
Jesters and Jokers of medieval times were required to bring levity to the court and to meet
the Kings requests. One Jester was required to entertain and amuse his King on demand, and if
he failed, he was killed. The Jester lived - we call it "Jokers Belief”5 nationalities with 5
influences bringing you a fusion of funk, rock and Neo soul. "Joker's Belief were signed by Kun Records(Beijing) in May 2016. Same year when band was created. Our EP was about to launch towards the end of September(2016). But studio didn't provide anything that was said in the contract. Except studio time. We were just going there on our own, and try to record. But its not working this way. There should be experienced studio engineer who leads the bands and help them to polish the sound during recording. So at the end nothing came out....

Now we need to start all over again. And we need your help to support the band in this path. We have so many good songs, and we want to release good quality EP.

All the funds will go for:

-----> RE-recording all the tracks in the studio. (Booking studio time and sound engineer)

-----> Mixing

-----> Mastering

-----> Printing CDs

-----> Arrange small EP release launch

PS: And of course all people who gonna support us, will receive all the songs via download (maybe even CD, if we figure out shipping things).

 

Here are more links to our videos:

Joker's Belief at Shenyang Fete de La Musique:

http://v.pptv.com/show/l9q4N58FdbMWlPw.html?rcc...

 

Joker's Belief at Mao:

http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTg0MTczMzc2NA==....


Joker's Belief - Hit the Hi-Hat:
http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTUwODAwMjk3Ng==....

Joker's Belief - Hit the Hi-Hat (Guitar & Sax solo)
http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTQzNjA3OTg5Mg==....

Joker's Belief - It's OK (Boom Bam Boom):
http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTQ1NjE3NzU3Mg==....


Joker's Belief - Ain't The War:
http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTQzNjA1NjM2OA==....

Joker's Belief-Ain't the war:

http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTQxNTU4NzU5Mg==....

 

Thank you all!

Best Regards,
Fareed aka Dojo Shaolin

story:
Short Summary

I am Kerry Jayne, a singer/songwriter situated in Peterborough ON. I have been playing and preforming in both BC and ON for about 10 years. I am passionate about music and songwriting, I am always looking for opportunity and growth.

In 2014. I finished my first album titled Wheels of the Grand. A song from that album, Dreaming, was a nominee for roots category at the Vancouver Island Music Awards. I have since relocated to Peterborough, Ontario because I fell in love.  I have been here since the fall of 2014 and in that time made many wonderful friends and music connections. I have played at great venues in town, and began recording with local producer James McKenty. I had to stop recording for lack of funds. I applied for a grant, but did not receive it. I had also just opened up my own salon, a green salon, and did not have the extra money to record.

I am a year into my new business, and things are going great but money is still tight. It is important to me to finish this project and to grow as a performer. I think I have something to share, and I want to continue to immerse myself in the arts community. 

Your contributions can give me the opportunity to develop and push myself as an artist. Anything can happen.

What your contribution will go towards:

Studio Recording $1500 - (Already put in $800 of my own money; still need $700)
Mixing $1000
Mastering $600
Art work $200
CD Printing $800
 

There will be perks with your donation: CDs, T Shirts, And a super special surprise.

If I don't reach my goal of $3,300, whatever generous donations I do receive will go towards the album's mixing and mastering. If your generosity pushes the campaign over the goal, the extra funds will go towards launching the album and producing a video.
