story:
About Us


NAGA APPAREL is a Black owned lifestyle brand established in Hamburg -Germany.

 

The brand is targeted at the Skateboarding, Urban, and Youth culture in general.

Naga stands for one who is wise. Inspired by the ancient culture.

Another important goal for us is to become successful not just for myself but also for others. We want to be able to create substantial opportunities for other people of colour and diversify in the landscape of the fashion world and beyond.

 

 

This blend of modern and traditional values is what gives Naga its unique identity.
Naga Apparel produces live and digital events, media, albums, merchandise and is creating an online platform aimed at growing and feeding the Urban music community and its fans, we are eager to offer more items for pre-order as we approach our goal,

Your TRACKSUIT advantages summarized:

  1. cosy and durable fabrics
  2. top price-performance ratio
  3. NAGA is a real brand with real people behind

 

 

 

 

 

Our Events

NAGA JAM Events are known for its gritty Flavor.

Artist like NOLAY, MISS LA FAMILIA, FIGURE FLOWS, BIG TWINS, RAPPER SCHOOL, CAPUZ, KLICK 99, KITTY KAT, SHABAZZ THE DISCIPLE
and more have blessed our Stage.

 

 

With thousands of attendees, and more than 40 artists, NAGA JAM has been a destination for Urban Concerts, since 2017.

 

 

Get on Board


Naga Apparel invites you to join our proposition to provide a space where talented artists, musicians and fashion designers can build. Our Vision is to grow by creating exclusive artist and business-based content to share throughout the year, a proper hub for Artist Promotion.

 

 

All of us musicians have suffered countless cancellations of our performances during the last couple of months. Despite major setbacks due to COVID-19 we are looking ahead to solve what has been missing all those years. Other Cities have developed vibrant ecosystems that allow fans and artists to connect through radio stations, engage with dedicated press outlets, around the culture, which is not the case for Urban Music in Hamburg - Germany.

 

Latest updates

We just developed Streamii, an easy to use, NFC streaming experience.

Our internet platform is designed to empower creators and their audiences.

 

 

It's an entirely new business model for online music creators!

 

 

See the desktop version of Streamii by clicking here.
(We're in the process of building native apps for mobile devices)

 

 

 

Things to do!:

 

• Studio Upgrades: Soundproofing, Rent for the room.

• Studio Equipment: Upgraded mixer, microphones, headphones, furniture

• Android app cost and monthly web data storage and website maintenance.

• Tracksuit production, (multiple colours).

 

 

 

 

 

This is the first time we are asking directly for support. With your help, we can improve and keep the airwaves busy with many amazingly produced content! We are hoping to raise € 21,000.

 

Reasons to Invest

1. Opportunity to give Musicians, Youth and Entrepreneurs the environment to showcase their skillset.

2.Build a proper Urban Radio Station

3. Improve the overall experience by Increasing the production value of Woodland 360

4. Improving the fan experience.

5. Get our latest Tracksuits

 

We would like to personally invite you to participate and join this mission.

 

 

Help us build WOODLAND 360  into Hamburgs’s largest outlet for Urban Music. Put your money where your heart is and Help us expand this platform to positive and empowering Media.

Since not everyone can afford to contribute, even a post or tweet about our Campaign is greatly appreciated. Share our posts and tweets, to help spread the word.

 

Thank you for taking the time to learn about Naga Apparel and its Campaign.
Together we can spread more positivity in the world. Yours truly NAGA APPAREL

 

https://naga-clothing.de

story:
Us & The Project

We are a family of friends who loves to worship Jesus, and have a deep passion for writing the songs that shape the next generations of believers. All we do is for the purpose of spreading a culture of worship that is based on honesty, truth, and family to our country and BEYOND.

What you can help us with, is the BEYOND part.
We released three norwegian worship songs earlier this year, but now we feel is the right time to release in english, which has been our main focus and dream all along.
The whole Expect Rain team of writers all write mainly in english, so this is natural for all of us.

With your contribution, you will help us produce, release and distribute our single "Clouds/Veil,"
which will be a spring board for upcoming releases from us.
A full english worship album is our goal, and this would help us to do exactly that later.

Where The Money Goes

We need approximately 2.000€ to do this project, and this is the specific things
that need to get payed for, in the order in which it is prioritized:

  • Production & Studio Time.
  • Renting a Drummer.
  • Mastering & Distribution of the song. (Spotify, iTunes and more...)
  • Cover Photo. (Picture used is not the cover photo.)
  • Advertising in Social Media.
  • Lyric Video. (To the Editor.)

The impact that we'll have with our music will have a lot to do with your contribution.
All the people we reach, you have also reached with us.
Thank you so much for sowing into us!

What If We Don't Achieve Our Goal?

While this crowdfunding is going on, we are also doing our part to get enough money for it,
if anything doesn't go as we hoped or planned. But we hope that we can save all that money
for the big full album coming later. So saying that; You also help us release our full album by contributing to this single, is not an understatement.

Other Ways You Can Help

To you who contribute financially into this project - Thank You So Much!!
But if you don't have the opportunity to help us financially, but still want to contribute,
there is other ways to do exactly that:

  • Spread the word out about our campaign, and make others do the same.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Everything in Social Media helps IMMENSELY!

So however you contribute, we really love you. Thank you so much!!

Love, from the Expect Rain Family.
story_txt:
Us & The Project
We are a family of friends who loves to worship Jesus, and have a deep passion for writing the songs that shape the next generations of believers. All we do is for the purpose of spreading a culture of worship that is based on honesty, truth, and family to our country and BEYOND.What you can help us with, is the BEYOND part.We released three norwegian worship songs earlier this year, but now we feel is the right time to release in english, which has been our main focus and dream all along.The whole Expect Rain team of writers all write mainly in english, so this is natural for all of us.
With your contribution, you will help us produce, release and distribute our single "Clouds/Veil,"which will be a spring board for upcoming releases from us.A full english worship album is our goal, and this would help us to do exactly that later.

Where The Money Goes
We need approximately 2.000€ to do this project, and this is the specific thingsthat need to get payed for, in the order in which it is prioritized:

Production & Studio Time.
Renting a Drummer.
Mastering & Distribution of the song. (Spotify, iTunes and more...)
Cover Photo. (Picture used is not the cover photo.)
Advertising in Social Media.
Lyric Video. (To the Editor.)

The impact that we'll have with our music will have a lot to do with your contribution.All the people we reach, you have also reached with us.Thank you so much for sowing into us!
What If We Don't Achieve Our Goal?While this crowdfunding is going on, we are also doing our part to get enough money for it,if anything doesn't go as we hoped or planned. But we hope that we can save all that moneyfor the big full album coming later. So saying that; You also help us release our full album by contributing to this single, is not an understatement.
Other Ways You Can Help
To you who contribute financially into this project - Thank You So Much!!But if you don't have the opportunity to help us financially, but still want to contribute,there is other ways to do exactly that:

Spread the word out about our campaign, and make others do the same.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Everything in Social Media helps IMMENSELY!

So however you contribute, we really love you. Thank you so much!!Love, from the Expect Rain Family.

story:
Stinas visor

Visbandet Stinas visor består av Stina Klintbom - sång, Magnus Markling - mandolin, kör och tin whistle, Andreas Nordanstig - gitarrer, kör, Johan Bengtsson - kontrabas och Hanna Austern - fiol, kör. Bandet fick ett första genomslag 2010 med Tågresa som vann tävlingen Svensktoppen nästa i P4 Göteborg. 2014 kom debutalbumet När jag mötte dig med en titellåt som blev populär i bröllopssammanhang. Sedan dess har bandet utvecklats mycket både som musiker och inom låtskrivande. Det har varit riktigt härligt att spela in de nya låtarna till albumet Medan bäcken brusar och nu har vi under ett års tid tillsammans med vår producent finslipat det hela till något vi är riktigt stolta över!

Här kan ni höra ett smakprov på singeln Du lever ännu: https://open.spotify.com/track/0KB4hTwPspGHeOCC...

Att driva ett visband är långt ifrån vinstdrivande. För att få det hela att gå runt krävs det att bandmedlemmarna lägger mycket fritid för ibland nästan inget gage. Därför har det varit tajt att få ihop budgeten till detta projekt.  För att kunna ro albumet i hamn hoppas vi därför att ni kan hjälpa oss med ett ekonomiskt bidrag. Ett stipendium från Ale kommun hjälpte oss att betala en liten del av inspelningskostnaderna, men det är långt ifrån det enda som kostar. Vi skulle bli väldigt tacksamma om ni ville hjälpa oss med det sista steget i albumprocessen – att trycka upp en CD!

Mastringskostnader: 4000 kr
Uppläggningsavgift digital distribution: 1000 kr 
Tryckkostnader fysisk CD: 8100 kr

=13100 kr

Detta får du som tack för hjälpen!

50 kr Signerat bandfoto

170 kr Signerad CD Medan bäcken brusar

300 kr Signerad CD Medan bäcken brusar + Signerad CD När jag mötte dig 

500 kr Privat instrumental- eller sånglektion 
(Välj något av bandets instrument. Begränsat med platser)

10 000 kr Privat hemma-spelning med Stinas visor (Göteborg med omnejd)

 

Observera: Om du inte har möjlighet att bidra ekonomiskt så är vi jätteglada om du vill hjälpa till att sprida detta genom att dela på dina sociala medier. Tack!

story:
You met with Mr. Krabs, Futurama made it happen in the future, now it's our turn to make it happen in the real world.



Create the world's smallest violin means a new challenge for engineering, in the form of a piece of art.


I'm just a simple and honest scientist from a third world country known as Chile, who wants to make the guinness record world smallest violin ever built by man. While new forms science are created.


 To make this I need a million dollars that will allow to work with best engineers, scientists and musicians in creating an wonderful artifact .

and as a reward for collaborate with this proyect, and to motivate you to help me,

I will be raffled the piece among all donors.


With esta money I will do:


1. Founding a world nonprofit organization dedicated to create instances that promote the use of new forms of science.
2. Create the first small science laboratory in the  world.
3.-Built World Smallest Violin under the highest standards that humanity and science offer and budget allows.


The project is ambitious, but it can change the way we think about science.


Help sharing and spreads this initiative that aims to realize the dream that I share with Professor Hubert Farnsworth and Mr. Krabs.


Thanks =) and Be Happy.

story:
Musical! (compatible with iPhone, iPad and iPod touch) will be a virtual playground for you to explore, discover and learn about music with the help of a piano, a fretted instrument (guitar / bass) and a playable staff. All of this in one single app!

Key features:

  • Customize Instruments: Change the number of keys of the piano, the number of strings (4 to 8), sound and tuning of the fretted instrument, and the clef (Bass, Alto, Tenor, Treble) of the staff. Tweak them to meet your needs.
  • From Basic to Advanced: Whether you are a beginner, a music student or a pro, Musical! will be a valuable tool at your disposal. From simple note positions to chords derived from a certain mode of a scale, you can dive freely through the vast sea of Musical! knowledge.
  • Grammatically Correct: You'll get accurate and grammatically correct information about intervals, scales and chords. i.e. When finding an interval, say an Ascending Augmented Sixth from C, Musical! will give you a A# rather than Bb. If you want to find a Ascending Minor Seventh however, Bb will be the answer.
  • Beyond the Conventional: Curious to learn more about obscure notes like B# or Fb? What about Double-Sharps or Double-Flats? Do they even exist? Well, this little app's got you covered!

Go deep and find information about:

  • Note: Solfège name, enharmonics, accidentals and octaves.
  • Interval: Enharmonic intervals, distance (in Whole and Half Steps) and inversions.
  • Scale: Alternate names, modes and chords derived from the scale.
  • Chord: Alternate spellings, positions and inversions.

You can also just have fun and play with your favorite instrument!


A Little Sample

Showcasing the app progress and the Instrument module.



The Funds


Reward Info

On some rewards you can get a Skype lesson, be featured on one of my YouTube videos and I'll even write a song for you. 'Great' you say, 'but I don't know your work!'. No problemo, you can:

  • Visit my YouTube channel.
  • Listen to some of my music on SoundCloud.
  • Check out the song I wrote for the project video, Unite.

Risks & Challenges

Life is very unpredictable, that's why I've given myself a year to develop, polish and publish the app along with the website. Ample time to cover any possible delays that might come along the way.

One big challenge would be the distribution of the app. Finding a way to smoothly deliver it to you, awesome backers, has proven to be somewhat of a headache for other app crowdfunding campaigns, big and small. I'm actively researching this matter to find the best way to get the Musical! app to your mighty device.


Thank you!

story:
Why and What is Projection Powder?

Projection Powder is Project Paperclip's 2nd album, and is the 6th volume of the Malkhut Series. It is a concept album about Edward Kelley, John Dee and the House of the Donkey in the Cradle. Fusing Enochian, Post-Punk and Moravian Folk, this album represents a new genre of musick... Geomantick Tribal Punk. 

What We Need & What You Get

The recordings are finished and we will mix and master the 13 tracks very soon. I have already paid for this entire album myself, so the only thing that needs funding is the Vinyl. 

The Impact

What I thought was a finished product back in 2013 morphed into a new genre about 1 year ago when I brought Karel Holas and Iva Marešová on board to help me finish the project. Two of the absolute finest Czech musicians mixed with the founding guitarist from P.I.L. and the drummer from Prong, and the rest of us ugly mugs!!! The tracks sound absolutely amazing, and I am excited for the World to finally be able to hear this Musick... 93

story:
Short Summary

Hey we are Stef and Matt, We both grew up in church all our lives and singing in church at a young age. I with my Father's Church in Qeens New York, And Matt in His home church and touring all over the united states for the glory of God. Matt and I have been through some tough times but Our Hearts Remain Loving God and Serving Him in Glory and His Truth. But we can't do this without you our friends and family Matt and I believe that God has given us a gift and we want to share that with the world. It would be great if you can join us in this musical journey. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3500.00                                                                                                                                               With Your Donations it will help us with Gas, Hotel for a week, food and other expenses.                 

When you donate to help us reach our goal we have some amazing gift packages.                               Everything from a hand written letter thank you for your donation to a signed poster, Our brand new Cover songs CD to us cooking you dinner and having a private party 

The Impact

We just want to reach as many people as we can for the Glory of God and taking a step of faith and moving forward we know God has given us a gift and we want to use it for him. And this could be the opportunity that God can use for His Glory.  

Risks & Challenges

To be honest Matt and I live from paycheck to paycheck and with taking care of 3 kids it gets very hard sometime. The truth is this is a huge blessing with an opportunity like this, but we can't do it without you our friends and family. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't make a donation life is hard but we would love for you to pray for us and pray God's Will for our lives. And we would also ask that you share this link on your Facebook page and share with your church and your friends and family. 

Thank you and God Bless

story:
Summary

Temple of Perdition is in the midst of finishing its second album and has come to the point where we need to get our drummer in studio and mixing and mastering before release.  We have worked hard to bring you a new side to the project and we know that our fans will be extremely pleased. 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • Studio time for our drummer. 
  • To pay our engineer for mixing and mastering of Inheritance of lies. 

What you get for supporting us:

  • Anyone who contributes $30 or more will have their names immortalized in the support thank you section in our album booklet. 
  • Anyone who contributes $100 or more will receive a special limited signed and numbered alternative album art of Inheritance of lies. This edition will come with a bonus track that will not be released on digital and physical formats. Only you will have a chance to hear it. 
  • Each person who contributes will be thanked via facebook.

To pay our engineer for mixing and mastering of Inheritance of lies.

Each person who contributes will be thanked via facebook.

story:
Sag-show har kørt siden 70erne på Sankt Annæ gymnasium, og er nordeuropas største elevproducerede musical. Alt musikken er skrevet, spillet, indspillet og udgivet af os elever. For første gang har vi mulighed for at udgive alt musikken fra showet på vinyl. 

Dobbelt LPen vil indeholde både de klassiske, rytmiske og elektroniske sange, på eksklusiv farvet vinyl. Der bliver lavet et specielt grafisk design til sleevet. 

Forudsætningen for at udgivelsen kan lade sig gøre er at der forudbestilles 100 plader senest d. 7. Januar 2018.

Alle pladerne vil kunne hentes under et af Sag-show forstillingerne mod fremvisning af kvittering.

Opnår vi ikke de 100 købere, vil dine penge automatisk blive returneret efter 5 arbejdsdage. 

(Prisen er 200 danske kroner)

story:
We will be releasing a song a week for three weeks on Facebook and Reverbnation.com/theminutians for three weeks. Check them out!

If you like what you hear, our album is available for purchase immediately on Itunes, Google Play, and CDBaby. Just search "The Minutians."

If you really like what you hear, consider purchasing a physical copy the of the CD here on Indiegogo, which we will mail to you within a month. 

If you really really like what you hear, you can support The Minutians by pledging $30 and be mentioned as a supporter in the professionally mastered release's liner notes! Also, If we raise enough money for a vinyl pressing of the professionally mastered version, you'll get a copy mailed to you!

story:
Short Summary

Eugene Kaminsky, librettist and poet, and I, Nissim Khalifa, composer of symphonic music, met during our master's degree studies in composition, and have been collaborating ever since.

We would like to introduce our never-before produced, Irish-myth-based opera! A dream Nissim had envisioned for a long time, almost 20 years.

Over the course of the last two years this dream has finally become a reality — a fully composed and orchestrated opera of Fionn Mc'Cool!

The opera draws inspiration from traditional Irish music, especially Sean-nós, creating a novel combination between the opera genre and Irish tradition and folklore. 

What We Need & What You Get

The entire sum will be invested to have a fully staged performance that will require:

- Performers: soloists, choir, and orchestra.

- Behind the scenes: Director, Producer, Costumes, stage crew and set, audio and video recording.

- Public relations: ads etc.

Be sure to view our perks that start from a special thank you, audio and/or video recording, signed copies of the opera's full score, and goes up to a ticket to the opera premiere!!

One special perk is already reserved for JIM FITZPATRICK for allowing us to use his amazing illustrations in all of our campaign videos :)

The Impact

As artists, we find universal beauty and qualities in the Irish national ethos, which, together with the novel adaption of the story as an opera plot, have an UNPRECEDENTED POTENTIAL for a mutual enrichment between Irish culture and the Opera genre!

The opera is the fruit of two years of our collaborative labor — moving back and forth from composition to writing, where at times, the music inspired the writing and at other times, the writing inspired the music.

During this process, we recruited many talented opera singers dedicated to the cause, who invested hours in recording demos in Nissim's home studio :)

Risks & Challenges

We would like to have the opera up and running within a short period of time, while maintaining a high level of execution. Some challenges may come up along the way: 

How do we present Aillen (the creature) in a frightening manner and make him BLOW FIRE OUT OF HIS MOUTH?! :) We have some ideas for that. Stay tuned for updates, and maybe offer a solution of your own!

Designing the set so it will show Fionn's journey throughout the opera in a believable manner and at a reasonable cost.

If some shortage in funds should arise during production due to unexpected events and/or setbacks — we will make sure to remain within budget by finding a way to cut back on the costs of one of the production aspects. 

And one BIG ISSUE,should we use the real 'Water of Life' (Whiskey) in rehearsals, or only at the premiere after party? ;)

Our Team

Other Ways You Can Help

Raising awareness for our project is very important and you play a significant role in that! 

The bigger the audience, the bigger the chances of us raising the funds and reaching our goal.

Share this campaign with everyone that you know and TAKE PART IN OUR CAUSE.

FIONN: Characters & overview
 

 

More music! (excerpts)

 

FIONN: Act I - Overture

FIONN: Tara's Awakening

FIONN: Prologue

FIONN: Act II - Overture

FIONN: Act II - Interlude

What We Need & What You Get
The entire sum will be invested to have a fully staged performance that will require:
- Performers: soloists, choir, and orchestra.
- Behind the scenes: Director, Producer, Costumes, stage crew and set, audio and video recording.
- Public relations: ads etc.
Be sure to view our perks that start from a special thank you, audio and/or video recording, signed copies of the opera's full score, and goes up to a ticket to the opera premiere!!
One special perk is already reserved for JIM FITZPATRICK for allowing us to use his amazing illustrations in all of our campaign videos :)

The Impact
As artists, we find universal beauty and qualities in the Irish national ethos, which, together with the novel adaption of the story as an opera plot, have an UNPRECEDENTED POTENTIAL for a mutual enrichment between Irish culture and the Opera genre!
The opera is the fruit of two years of our collaborative labor — moving back and forth from composition to writing, where at times, the music inspired the writing and at other times, the writing inspired the music.
During this process, we recruited many talented opera singers dedicated to the cause, who invested hours in recording demos in Nissim's home studio :)

Risks & Challenges
We would like to have the opera up and running within a short period of time, while maintaining a high level of execution. Some challenges may come up along the way: 
How do we present Aillen (the creature) in a frightening manner and make him BLOW FIRE OUT OF HIS MOUTH?! :) We have some ideas for that. Stay tuned for updates, and maybe offer a solution of your own!
Designing the set so it will show Fionn's journey throughout the opera in a believable manner and at a reasonable cost.
If some shortage in funds should arise during production due to unexpected events and/or setbacks — we will make sure to remain within budget by finding a way to cut back on the costs of one of the production aspects. 
And one BIG ISSUE,should we use the real 'Water of Life' (Whiskey) in rehearsals, or only at the premiere after party? ;)
Our Team


Other Ways You Can Help
Raising awareness for our project is very important and you play a significant role in that! 
The bigger the audience, the bigger the chances of us raising the funds and reaching our goal.
Share this campaign with everyone that you know and TAKE PART IN OUR CAUSE.

Jessianna, Jared, & Dr Jeff are ¡JAZZED! collaborating as "Music Passion Fire®"  ​CoProducers  on our RockinBlue RoadHouse© ¡LIVE!  Debut DVD TrioSet™ project. Our combined family dedicated career years as Pro Musicians & Cultural Enterpreneurs are a SoCali Groovy Kewl harmonious heritage of 15 passionate dedicated decades. 100's of UTV USA©  MusicVidz™ VictoryVault™ rare analog GigGems & precious JamJewels are now curated, polished & ready to be passionately uniquely mounted into our RockinBlue RoadHouse© ¡LIVE! Debut DVD TrioSet™. We are seeking Passionate Music Lovers like YOU  to support our Indie Musicians in our UTV Music & TeleVision Studios USA© family Cultural Entreprenuerial virtuoso vision and our performing artist 150 year harmonious heritage providing audience access to     SwordEdge™ (tobacco/alcohol/drug free) ¡LIVE! concert venue experiences as we pioneer  Pro Music television stellar performances making & documenting Music History on SOA stages & on recorded media since 1974.

OUR COMPOSER & FOUNDER CALIFORNIA DREAMIN & MUSIC GOLDMINE CLAIM STAKIN CIRCA   1974

UTV USA© was originally created in Iowa by our composer, Music Maven, and Musician Champion Jessianna K Wingert in 1974. Classically trained in Piano, Organ, Clarinet, Voice & Dance she was a featured vocalist and pipe organist soloist in her parish cathedral church in elementary school in her hometown of Fort Dodge. She became a student Dance Instructor at the age of 10; performed on academic, local, & statewide television; and Principal Master Dance Instructor & Choreographer of the Josephine Johannes Peddicord Dance Studio© at age 15. She received numerous awards in high school solo clarinet competitions; was seated as First Chair First Clarinet for three years and held the first female pioneer seat as St Edmond High School Band President her Senior year.  When she saw the movie "A Hard Day's Night©"  portraying a "typical" day in the life of The Beatles in 1964 at the age of 8  it was a seminal defining experience after stereo playin & diggin the Music of The Beatles on vinyl 45's for a year.

Jessianna worked at three Iowa radio stations as commercial account executive; continuity writer; recorded & on air voice talent; journalist & program host; and programming consultant. She conducted an exclusive on air interview of the CLONE BAND of CHICAGO;  and the on venue exclusive backstage interview with her colleague of Jefferson Starship at the Hilton Coliseum in Ames, Iowa both for KTGA FM Radio Fort Dodge, Iowa.  Jessianna received distinction as Iowa Cultural Entrepreneur from the Iowa Governor's Arts Council Program Imagine Iowa 2010. 

Jessianna pioneered her cultural focus leased cable access television program                    "Rockin & Rollin Round Ft Dodge©" UTV USA Series  as Producer/Host                                      and Unicorn RockGarden SwordEdge© Music Night Club  as Owner/Producer                             from 1997 - 2002. Jessianna showcased a duo total of 1,600 Pro Musicians on SOA stages      in her company trademark exclusively alcohol & drug free Swordedge™  venues.

COPRODUCER & MASTER SOUND ENGINEER JARED "JD WINGS" WINGERT

" JARED "JD WINGS" WINGERT IS THAT BOY FROM IOWA WHO CAN PLAY & SING"

Buddy Miles  2001

Jimi Hendrix Band of Gypsys Drummer - Buddy Miles & his Buddy Miles Express Band

 

 

Jessianna's son Pro Drummer & Vocalist Jared "JD WINGS" Wingert started playing the drums professionally at the age of 10. Classically trained in percussion and voice and awarded full collegiate scholarship in both instrumental & vocal departments he has also performed on local, statewide, and regional television. In 2001 when he was 25 Jared and his band Spooky Mojo© opened a club gig for the former drummer of the Jimi Hendrix Band of Gypsys©  - Buddy Miles & his Buddy Miles Express Band©.  Buddy was impressed with Spooky Mojo©  and their performance giving them props and praise and dubbed Jared as           " ...that boy from Iowa who can play and sing." You can ¡DIG! Spooky Mojo© as one of our RBRH© featured anchor house bands on our Music Passion Fire® Debut DVD TrioSet™.  You can also ¡DIG! Jared kickin da TUBZ & WAILIN with Grant Gospel Group; Hell or High Water w/da Infamous Horns; and The Mudpuppies.

Jared was Stage Manager/Master Sound Engineer on the "Rockin & Rollin                            Round Ft Dodge© " UTV USA©  cable series. He brings a unique artistic luminosity to our  "Music Passion Fire®"  project. He is routinely referred to as the Musician's Musician  by his colleagues from five generations. Jared has performed in thousands of pro gigs and concerts in the USA including the 1985 SE Iowa Multiple Sclerosis Telethon in Burlington, Iowa as both the opening and closing performer; the 2017 Iowa State Fair with Richie Lee & The Fabulous 50's;  the feature band performance of Bill Dewey & The Dynamics at the 2010 Johnny Cash Festival in Atlanta, Georgia and three appearances at the revered by exclusive artist/band event invitation  British Luncheon Concert/Buddy Holly Memorial Winter Dance Party  at the famous       Surf Ballroom in Clear Lake, Iowa.

Dr Jeff Gitarre is a Doctor of Psychology, and Pro Rock, Blues, & Jazz Guitarist & Vocalist. He brings 56 years of artistic musicianship, virtuosity, and entrepreneurial expertise to our RockinBlue RoadHouse© !LIVE!  Debut DVD TrioSet™  project                                             "Music Passion Fire®." Dr Jeff has performed at thousands of Pro Gigs in the USA as well as tours with two internationally renowned Rock & Blues bands in Europe. He is currently developing his American Veteran PTSD Treatment/Music Therapy Program – Music Evolution® . Originally from the East Coast he has called Southern California home for 53 years.

                                                                                                 Cultural Entrepreneurship in our Soulz
Jessianna, Jared, & Dr Jeff are ¡JAZZED! collaborating as "Music Passion Fire®"  ​CoProducers  on our RockinBlue RoadHouse© ¡LIVE!  Debut DVD TrioSet™ project. Our combined family dedicated career years as Pro Musicians & Cultural Enterpreneurs are a SoCali Groovy Kewl harmonious heritage of 15 passionate dedicated decades. 100's of UTV USA©  MusicVidz™ VictoryVault™ rare analog GigGems & precious JamJewels are now curated, polished & ready to be passionately uniquely mounted into our RockinBlue RoadHouse© ¡LIVE! Debut DVD TrioSet™. We are seeking Passionate Music Lovers like YOU  to support our Indie Musicians in our UTV Music & TeleVision Studios USA© family Cultural Entreprenuerial virtuoso vision and our performing artist 150 year harmonious heritage providing audience access to     SwordEdge™ (tobacco/alcohol/drug free) ¡LIVE! concert venue experiences as we pioneer  Pro Music television stellar performances making & documenting Music History on SOA stages & on recorded media since 1974.
OUR COMPOSER & FOUNDER CALIFORNIA DREAMIN & MUSIC GOLDMINE CLAIM STAKIN CIRCA   1974

UTV USA© was originally created in Iowa by our composer, Music Maven, and Musician Champion Jessianna K Wingert in 1974. Classically trained in Piano, Organ, Clarinet, Voice & Dance she was a featured vocalist and pipe organist soloist in her parish cathedral church in elementary school in her hometown of Fort Dodge. She became a student Dance Instructor at the age of 10; performed on academic, local, & statewide television; and Principal Master Dance Instructor & Choreographer of the Josephine Johannes Peddicord Dance Studio© at age 15. She received numerous awards in high school solo clarinet competitions; was seated as First Chair First Clarinet for three years and held the first female pioneer seat as St Edmond High School Band President her Senior year.  When she saw the movie "A Hard Day's Night©"  portraying a "typical" day in the life of The Beatles in 1964 at the age of 8  it was a seminal defining experience after stereo playin & diggin the Music of The Beatles on vinyl 45's for a year.
Jessianna worked at three Iowa radio stations as commercial account executive; continuity writer; recorded & on air voice talent; journalist & program host; and programming consultant. She conducted an exclusive on air interview of the CLONE BAND of CHICAGO;  and the on venue exclusive backstage interview with her colleague of Jefferson Starship at the Hilton Coliseum in Ames, Iowa both for KTGA FM Radio Fort Dodge, Iowa.  Jessianna received distinction as Iowa Cultural Entrepreneur from the Iowa Governor's Arts Council Program Imagine Iowa 2010. 
Jessianna pioneered her cultural focus leased cable access television program                    "Rockin & Rollin Round Ft Dodge©" UTV USA Series  as Producer/Host                                      and Unicorn RockGarden SwordEdge© Music Night Club  as Owner/Producer                             from 1997 - 2002. Jessianna showcased a duo total of 1,600 Pro Musicians on SOA stages      in her company trademark exclusively alcohol & drug free Swordedge™  venues. 
from the back cover of our
RockinBlue RoadHouse© ¡LIVE!  Debut DVD TrioSet™ "Music Passion Fire®" 
ITZ THURSDAY JULY 3 1997 AND I AM SITTING AT OUR WINDOW AUDIENCE TABLE IN OUR SOUTH DECK BALCONY AT OUR HISTORICAL ARCHITECTURALLY SIGNIFICANT DOWNTOWN MAIN & NORTH 10TH STREET ORIGINAL UNICORN ROCKGARDEN© NA NIGHT CLUB® IN IOWA.  TONIGHT AT 6PM MY SON JARED WINGERT AND I WILL BE CABLECASTING OUR VERY FIRST PROGRAM EDITION IN OUR VERY FIRST TELEVISION PRODUCTION “ROCKIN & ROLLIN ROUND FT DODGE©” COMMUNITY & CULTURAL FOCUS UTV USA© SERIES. OUR SWORDEDGE™ CLUB IS DARK TONIGHT AND JARED IS PLAYIN THE DRUMS & SINGING AT A GIG WITH ONE OF HIS 7 BANDS. FAST FORWARD YOUR OS VCR TO DECEMBER 2001. WE HAVE NOW SHOWCASED 1600 PROFESSIONAL MUSICIANS IN SE VENUES; PARTNERED WITH 160 NPOs;  and CONTRACTED 330 COMMERCIAL RRRFTD© SPONSORS. AND RECEIVED THOUSANDS OF RAVE VIEWER REVIEWS.                                                                                              
AND IN LESS THAN 90 DAYS FROM SEPTEMBER 11 WE HAD LOST OUR SERIES DUE TO THE 911 ATTACK, WAR & SUBSEQUENT ECONOMIC IMPACT.  AND RIGHT HERE AND NOW IN JUNE 2018 WE ARE HERE TO CLAIM & SHOWCASE THE RARE ORIGINAL FIERY JAM GIGGEMS AND PRECIOUS RAW JAMJEWELS THAT WE SAVED PRESERVED AND LOCKED IN OUR UTV  USA VICTORY VAULT FOR 20 YEARS.
                   AND TO RECLAIM OUR MUSIC PIONEER PRODUCER CAREERS                                                                     THAT WERE TAKEN FROM US. 
 Jessianna now lives in Southern California performing her Cultural Entrepreneur gigs, crafting alcohol free RockinBlue Roadhouse©  Bison Bodacious™ Root Beer,  and fostering SoCali community with RockinBlue Roadhouse© Southern California                                           Pacific Blues Swordedge™ Society®  NPO fundraising concerts.

  DES MOINES REGISTER NEWSPAPER FEATURE ARTICLE 
                                 METRO BUSINESS SECTION PAGE 2   AUGUST 24, 1998 

COPRODUCER & MASTER SOUND ENGINEER JARED "JD WINGS" WINGERT
" JARED "JD WINGS" WINGERT IS THAT BOY FROM IOWA WHO CAN PLAY & SING"
Buddy Miles  2001

Jimi Hendrix Band of Gypsys Drummer - Buddy Miles & his Buddy Miles Express Band

 
 

Jessianna's son Pro Drummer & Vocalist Jared "JD WINGS" Wingert started playing the drums professionally at the age of 10. Classically trained in percussion and voice and awarded full collegiate scholarship in both instrumental & vocal departments he has also performed on local, statewide, and regional television. In 2001 when he was 25 Jared and his band Spooky Mojo© opened a club gig for the former drummer of the Jimi Hendrix Band of Gypsys©  - Buddy Miles & his Buddy Miles Express Band©.  Buddy was impressed with Spooky Mojo©  and their performance giving them props and praise and dubbed Jared as           " ...that boy from Iowa who can play and sing." You can ¡DIG! Spooky Mojo© as one of our RBRH© featured anchor house bands on our Music Passion Fire® Debut DVD TrioSet™.  You can also ¡DIG! Jared kickin da TUBZ & WAILIN with Grant Gospel Group; Hell or High Water w/da Infamous Horns; and The Mudpuppies.
Jared was Stage Manager/Master Sound Engineer on the "Rockin & Rollin                            Round Ft Dodge© " UTV USA©  cable series. He brings a unique artistic luminosity to our  "Music Passion Fire®"  project. He is routinely referred to as the Musician's Musician  by his colleagues from five generations. Jared has performed in thousands of pro gigs and concerts in the USA including the 1985 SE Iowa Multiple Sclerosis Telethon in Burlington, Iowa as both the opening and closing performer; the 2017 Iowa State Fair with Richie Lee & The Fabulous 50's;  the feature band performance of Bill Dewey & The Dynamics at the 2010 Johnny Cash Festival in Atlanta, Georgia and three appearances at the revered by exclusive artist/band event invitation  British Luncheon Concert/Buddy Holly Memorial Winter Dance Party  at the famous       Surf Ballroom in Clear Lake, Iowa.                                               
   
                          
¡¡¡GREAT MUSIC PASSION FIRE DVD JAM KEEP ON ROCKIN!!!                                                                                                                 Dennis Morales/Drink Labs                                                                   thedrinklabs.com
 
 

                          ¡¡¡YOU SOUND GREAT KEEP ON DOIN WHAT YOU'RE DOING!!!                                                                      Merle "THE PERKOLATOR" Perkins/Drummer                                           2X INDUCTEE CHICAGO BLUES HALL of FAME
 
                                
Dr Jeff Gitarre is a Doctor of Psychology, and Pro Rock, Blues, & Jazz Guitarist & Vocalist. He brings 56 years of artistic musicianship, virtuosity, and entrepreneurial expertise to our RockinBlue RoadHouse© !LIVE!  Debut DVD TrioSet™  project                                             "Music Passion Fire®." Dr Jeff has performed at thousands of Pro Gigs in the USA as well as tours with two internationally renowned Rock & Blues bands in Europe. He is currently developing his American Veteran PTSD Treatment/Music Therapy Program – Music Evolution® . Originally from the East Coast he has called Southern California home for 53 years.

story:
OUR UNDYING DREAM 

Our dream, like most musicians, is to have our music heard and loved by our fans, and to travel the county and the world sharing it. Since our drummer Jesse passed, members came and went, each not quite fitting. Over the last year, we found the right mix and started recording our second album, our drive and determination ever growing. This past October, we acquired a manager who quickly brought an exceptional agent, with impressive connections, on board and things began to really take off for us. We are now at the juncture where we need to wrap up our album and finalize the details of the tour our manager and agent are putting together for us. We are blessed to have this once in a life-time opportunity and need your help to see it through. If we are unable to acquire funds, we will have to delay, postpone or potentially cancel. Our fans are our family, and we want you as our newest member! We all firmly believe that if it is not fun, we have no reason to do this, so jump on board and have the best time ever with us.

YOU

Your contributions will change our undying dream into a living, breathing reality.  Working extremely hard has brought us as far as we are able to go on our own. We are privileged to have an opportunity that very few other professional musicians will ever see; YOU will make the difference! By supporting us, you will make it possible for us to share our music with you and thousands of people all over the world, and have a lot of creepy good fun while we are at it. In a world that is often plagued by thoughts of boredom or commonality, help us be the exception. Let us entertain you!

WHAT HELP WE NEED FROM YOU

Completing our second album and going on a national tour is a massive project, we are just your everyday working class (yet luckily talented) guys shooting for the stars. We need your help to see this through. Be assured that we are personally continuing to diligently work on our projects and to generate and save all we can to promote our future. Creep is in need of funding for CD production and mastering. We have recorded and mixed the album on our own up to this point, but need the pros to step in for the final touches. As you can see from our video and photos, we have a very unique look and our staging goes right along with it. Since we have been at this for some time we are in need of some new equipment and props to give you, and our fans, what they expect from Creep...a magnificent show! Getting to and from our tour dates is a challenge when we haul all of our gear with us.  To make traveling make sense, we need an enclosed trailer so that the band members will all be in one vehicle and the gear will be safely with us as well. Our instruments are our livelihood. It also just makes sense economically. Playing in different cities throughout the weeks leaves us in hotels and on the road more often than not, and that can be costly enough that touring is not a wise option. We need your help supplementing our travel fund. And lastly, we need your generosity offsetting the cost of designing, producing, and purchasing merchandise for you and our fans.  Merch, as it's called, is the one reliable generator of revenue for bands that are trying to get their careers off of the ground. If we do not have it, we cannot sell it to you and our fans. We need to design and buy merch representing our new record and the upcoming tour. Whew! That sounds like a whole lot of stuff we need, but actually we have thrown in every dime we have to get to this point, and these requests are the bare necessities. If we are unable to reach our campaign goal, any funds received will still go directly to the above mentioned requests, but let's hope that we hit that goal and then some. WE WANT TO PLAY FOR YOU!!

CD production/mastering $1500

Touring expenses $2000

Trailer $3000

Staging/equipment $1500

Merch $2000

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

Creep will never ask for anything for free, we just need a hand up. We have lots of rewards to offer to you for your contributions. Your rewards include everything from stickers, to drum stix, to CDs both hard copy and digital, a 36x24 poster, to t-shirts, glow hoodies, and combinations of all sorts of wonderfully creepy things. We also have a Secret Perk if you are so inclined to fund us $300.00... extra Creepy things await! If you are interested in helping Creep fulfill our dream while entertaining you, but you just do not have the money to donate, no worries! There are other ways you can help out. We will be offering rewards to those of you that refer our campaign to your friends and contacts on your social media accounts. **Make sure you use the INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS so that analytics can keep track of your referrals. 

LASTLY

THANK YOU, SO MUCH!!  Thank you for taking your precious time to read about Creep.  Thank you for your generosity. Thank you for helping us take advantage of a once in a life-time opportunity. And thank you for choosing to help us realize our undying dream of sharing our music with the world!

Respectfully,

CREEP

BtheCreep, ~jR, Loachee, & Capt Creeper

Molly Braun, Manager @ Creep

molly@creeplair.com

story:
Hello!

I’m Evelyn, and I was born to imagine & create. It’s instinctual for me.  After graduating college, I now have the freedom and headspace to reinvite art into my life, and I finally feel at home in myself (!!). In the last six months, I’ve written over 15 songs, created a YouTube channel for sharing covers, and, inspired by the six-word story, I just released a micro-EP using my very basic tech.

They say necessity is the mother of invention, which has been a big mood for me this season. On New Year’s Eve, I boarded a plane to the UK with just a backpack & a suitcase and had to leave my instruments behind. I’ve been recording music on my iPad mini, using the lil earbuds as a microphone, and creating backing tracks from scratch with GarageBand. While it’s been a fun challenge to work with limited resources, I’m really excited to see what I can do with access to proper equipment. 

Money Talk

I’m shooting for $2300 to cover basic costs of instrument rental, recording, and production consultation. Also I’m turning 23, and it seems reasonable to fundraise 100 bucks for every year I’ve been alive. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Perks!

I will handwrite personal thank-you notes to everyone who contributes to the cause, and for donations of...

- $25+ : I’ll add a personalized doodle to your card  

-  $50+ : You get a shoutout on the EP release

- $100+ :  You get to pick what song I cover next

- $250+ : I’ll write a song for you or about you - your choice!

- $500+ : A personal concert for you AND a firm handshake

- $1000+ : You get to hear the EP pre-release AND I’ll tell you my secret banana bread recipe

- $2300+ : I will name my first pet after you

Impact

Your support truly means the world to me, and I am so grateful to have so many people in my life who inspire me and push me to chase my goals & passions. This is only the beginning, and I am so excited. 

Non-financial Support

If you are unable to contribute financially, here are some other ways you can support me before this baby arrives:

- Share the campaign and spread the word!

- Watch and engage with my weekly YouTube covers! (https://youtube.com/channel/UCNrI1_RqCO37CT1Vpj...)

- Send me encouraging messages! It can be really intimidating to push past perfectionism and pursue your passions (I’m using alliteration because I’m NERVOUS)!

- Feed your own creative side and share it: the more, the merrier!

story:
CAMPAGNE de FINANCEMENT -DAVIDSPOUTNIK 2

 

Bonjour à tous.

Au printemps 2017 j'ai lancé mon premier album de musique instrumentale, Davidspoutnik -Projet Matador (disponible sur Bandcamp: https://davidspoutnik.bandcamp.com/album/projet-matador)

Ce fut un des défis que je me suis lancé jusqu'ici qui m'aura rendu le plus fier: Produire un album en entier sur lequel j'ai joué de tous les instruments et où j'ai aussi enfilé successivement les chapeaux de compositeur, arrangeur, preneur de son, mixeur, etc.

Depuis, je suis revenu tout doucement à l'écriture de chansons, d'une part, et parallèlement à mes collaborations avec d'autres artistes, (dont le magnifique album de Lisbonne Télégramme lancé en 2019), j'ai décidé de m'atteler à un deuxième opus sous la bannière Davidspoutnik. Cette fois, j'ai envie d'amener ma recherche un peu plus loin et de m'entourer de musiciens avec qui je pourrai collaborer pour les arrangements et le travail de studio. Voilà.

Comme vous le savez sans doute, il est devenu de plus en plus difficile pour les  artisans de la musique de trouver le financement nécessaire à la réalisation de leurs projets de création. Les plus durement touchés par cette situation sont bien sûr les artistes eux-mêmes, les créateurs de contenu original, qui ne trouvent plus de partenaire financier comme par le passé et qui dans le contexte actuel ne reçoivent plus vraiment leur part du gâteau. Pendant que plusieurs intervenants de l'industrie en sont à essayer de comprendre le phénomène et à chercher des solutions, beaucoup d'artistes se tournent vers le socio-financement. Par le biais des réseaux sociaux aussi bien que par le bouche à oreille, le défi est de rejoindre le plus de gens possible pour réussir à amasser les quelques centaines de dollars qui permettront à l'artiste de réaliser son projet.

Voilà donc la raison qui m'amène aujourd'hui à solliciter votre aide. Pour arriver à mener à terme la réalisation de mon deuxième album instrumental, il me faut recueillir la somme nécessaire pour payer les musiciens invités et pour engager des techniciens pour le mixage et le mastering final. Je me suis fixé un objectif de 6000 dollars. Avec ce coup de pouce, je devrais arriver à produire les 12 pièces prévues pour l'album.

La sortie de l'album est prévue pour septembre 2020.

Donc, à vos chéquiers, vos tablettes, vos ordinateurs ! Votre contribution vous assure d'obtenir l'album en version numérique de DAVIDSPOUTNIK, tome 2, ainsi que ma reconnaissance éternelle.

Bien que le succès de l'entreprise ne repose pas entièrement sur vos épaules, soyez assurés que votre contribution fera une ÉNORME différence.

Une autre façon de m'apporter votre soutien est d'acheter aussi le premier tome Davidspoutnik -Projet Matador ici: https://davidspoutnik.bandcamp.com/album/projet-matador.

Le mini album de Taxi Zùlù est aussi disponible ici: https://taxizulu.bandcamp.com/releases. (Pour obtenir une copie CD écrivez-moi à davidspoutnik@hotmail.com.)

DAVIDSPOUTNIK: Compositions instrumentales aux ambiances cinématographiques, parfois expérimentales, où se mélangent des effets sonores, quelques bruits du quotidien, tissant une trame de musique de film évoquant l'univers des road movies, où l'on retrouve un peu de Ennio Morricone, un zeste d'atmosphère à la David Lynch, une pincée de Calexico et l'ombre de Tom Waits en plus de quelques démons du Trip-Hop, dans un amalgame de sonorités mariant la guitare électrique avec  les cordes, les cuivres, le mellotron, le piano, le vibraphone, la basse et la contrebasse, des sons de beat-box vintage, du pedal steel et du synthétiseur.

story:
Hallo Philippe hier! 

(ENGLISH VERSION BELOW)


Einige von euch kennen mich durch meine instrumentalen Soloalben oder vielleicht als Lehrer am MGI ...

Hiermit möchte ich Euch einladen, Teil meines neuem akustischen Soloalbum-Projekts zu sein.

Ich bin gerade in der letzten Phase der Fertigstellung des Albums und freue mich sehr, Euch in dieses Album einzubeziehen. Es ist eine neue Erfahrung und Möglichkeit meine Musik zu teilen. Ich bin sehr gespannt... :))

Mit meinem neuen Album möchte ich Jahrzehnte meiner Musik in einem Album erklingen lassen. Bedeutet, ich habe einige meiner "Best of" -Songs aus der Vergangenheit genommen, komplett neu arrangiert (nur Akustikgitarre) und mit weiteren Songs aus meinen letzten Jazz / Fusion-Einflüssen hinzugefügt.

Ich habe mit dem Album im August 2019 angefangen. Die ersten Musiker hören meine Musik und fügen ihren musikalischen "Fußabdruck" in das Album ... Ein Update über die Musiker wird bald folgen ...

Warum über Crowdfunding?

Der Grund ist sehr einfach: Ich möchte mit diesem Projekt unabhängig sein und Crowdfunding ist eine Möglichkeit, Musik so zu machen, wie ich es schon immer machen wollte + Menschen einzubeziehen, die meine Musik unterstützen möchten.

Es ist jetzt mein 8. Soloalbum und ich bin sehr gespannt auf das Ergebnis. Die gesamten Kompositionen, Arrangements, das Gitarrenspiel, das Mischen und das Neuarrangieren werden von mir in meinem Studio in Münster durchgeführt.

Was ich brauche:

  • Mittel für Musiker, das Drücken von CDs, Kunstwerken, das Mischen, Merchandising usw.
  • Ihr könnte dazu einfach eines  der angebotenen Pakete z.B. Download Link des neuen Albums, physische CD, signierte CD oder eine 60min. Skype Session mit mir buchen. (weitere Details auf der rechten Seite aufgelistet)
  • Alternativ könnt ihr einfach über den Button "Back it" einen EUR Betrag spenden (die Beträge werden rein für das Album verwendet).

Das bekommt ihr:

  • Das neue Album und Pre-Access zum Download
  • Merchandising-Artikel
  • Musik-Playbacks
  • Werden Sie Partner bei mir (Ihr Name steht auf dem Musikvideo)
  • Sie helfen, mein Album auf weltweiten Plattformen (iTunes, Amazon, Spotify usw.) zu starten und vieles mehr (siehe Pakete)


Merci:
Ich bin über jede Unterstützung dankbar und freue mich sehr wenn ihre Teil meines neuen Albums und musikalischen Abenteuers werden möchtet. Ihr seid die Musikfans, Gitarrenliebhaber und Unterstützer die meine Musik mögen. Eure Unterstützung wird mir helfen, konsequent an dem neuen Album zu arbeiten, die besten Musiker einzubeziehen und die musikalische Zusammenarbeit mit Euch weiter zu vertiefen...

Falls ihr weitere Ideen, Feedback etc. für mich habt, einfach eine Email an mich: philcall@freenet.de

Freundliche Grüße

Philippe

------------------ENGLISH------------------------

Hello, Philippe here!

 

Some of you know me through my instrumental solo albums or maybe as teacher at the MGI...

Herewith I would like to invite you to be part of my new acoustic solo album project.

I am currently in the last stage of finishing the album and very excited to in include you into that. Its a new experience and way to share my music, lets see...:))

With the new album I want to combine a few decades of music into one album. Meaning I took a few of my "Best of" songs from historic albums, arranged them totally new (only acoustic guitar) and added a few "New" songs with my latest Jazz / Fusion influences..

I started to work on the new album last year in August 2019 and I am working since today on it. First musicians are now listening to my music and adding their footprint into it...An update about musicians will follow soon...

Why via crowdfunding?

The reason is very simple: I want to be fully independent with this project and crowdfunding is a possibility to make music how I want to do it + include people which supports my music as a collaborator. 

Its now my 8th solo album and I am very excited about the result. All the composition, arrangements, guitar playing, mixing, re-arranging is done by myself in my studio in Münster.

What I Need:

  • Funds to involve musicians, pressing CDs, artwork, mixing, merchandising etc.
  • You can simply get one of the offered packages , i.e. Download link, physical CD, signed CD or a 60 min. Skype session (more details, see the right side of this page).
  • As alternative you can simply support me and contribute with EUR via the "Back it" button (all amount will be 100% used for the album).

What You Get:

  • The new album and pre access to download
  • Merchandising articles 
  • Music backing tracks
  • Become a partner with me (your name will be on the music video) 
  • You help to launch my album on world wide platforms (iTunes, Amazon, Spotify etc,)

Merci:

I would be very happy, thankful and of course glad to have you part of my new album and musical adventure. You are the music fans, guitar lovers and supporters which like my music, so I am able to share the music with the world. Your support will help me to consistently work on the new album, include the best musicians into it and further enhance the musical cooperation.

If you have any feedback to me, please feel free to contact me: philcall@freenet.de

Best regards

Philippe

story:
We are Thanks for Leaving

In 2011 we won the Gorilla Music Battle of the Bands in San Francisco. We recorded and released our debut, self titled album. Now, 5 years later we are ready to rerelease the album remixed and remastered by J7 Studios. This album was historic to the Half Moon Bay music scene and deserves to be heard in high quality audio.

Remixing, Remastering and Pressing

We need $2,000 to cover the costs of remixing and remastering the album as well as pressing physical copies and getting digital distribution on iTunes and Spotify. In order to do this we are offering pre-sale copies to our fans to thank them for their contributions. These will include exclusive Thanks for Leaving 5th Anniversary commemorative posters.

The Future

We are planning a comeback! We have new material written and are planning to record our second album. We have some shows in the works and this album will help us promote our music and allows us to explore new avenues and venues. It is VERY important that we have music in the highest quality when we shop it to labels and promoters so it is essential that our fans support this release.

Quality Ain't Cheap

Over the past years things have changed quite a bit. Some of us have started families, others have joined the workforce and started paying that dreaded Bay Area rent. We just can't afford to release this album out of pocket. We beckon our fans to band together on this with us to make this happen and keep the legacy alive. Your contributions do much more than fund an album. They mean more shows, more new music, better quality and bigger opportunities. In short your contributions are the future of TFL.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to make a contribution it's okay. We still love ya. You can still help our cause by sharing our campaign. Telling your friends, posting our videos and our songs and most importantly coming to our shows.

 

Thank you all in advance for being awesome!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, we are here to seek support from the lovely people around the country India and abroad. The Bodhisattwa Trio is a Jazz influenced rock project which started as a platform for sharing life's experiences of each of the members through music. The band has gained their fame after their first Europe tour post their first album 'Intersection's release. The second album Heart of Darkness, that was released last year, was ranked by Rolling Stone as one of the top 10 Indian releases in 2016 amongst other albums from varied genres.

This year the band got an invitation from Vilnius, Lithuania to play at the prestigious Vilnius Mama Jazz Festival. The only hinderance to their travel is that the organisers are not providing with any support to the band for the international travel. Hence we seek support from whoever is kind enough to help this talented and enthusiastic bunch to reach their deserved stage at Vilnius.

It is important for all of us to go and play at that festival as 'The Bodhisattwa Trio' represents contemporary Indian music apart from Indian classical & traditional music for which we are famous. With the opportunity of this kind it will be a great occasion to showcase the modern contemporary Jazz music to the rest of the world.

What We Need & What You Get

Okay! Lets clearly break it down the exchange for you:

  • To go to vilnius and come back we need $3500 which includes visa and international travel expenses for the entire band.
  • The festival stage is slated for the band on 17th November 2017. The band however will be traveling to Europe for the month from 20th October through 20th November 2017.
  • It would be obvious that you would get perks and they will come in digital copies/digital prints/bromide prints of exclusive band photos and an unreleased track remixed for this project exclusively.
  • If we can not reach our goal then that will bring us to an uncertainty about performing at VMJF. However, if we can not at all go there, all this fund will be spent in our album recording which is slated around February 2018.

The Impact

  • This project is very important to us because for a band like us, getting an invitation to play at a festival of the stature of Vilnius Mama Jazz Fest is more than we can ask for. In other words, this festival is one of the top prestigious festivals of Europe where musicians like Chick Corea, Wayne Shorter, Brian Blade, John McLaughlin, Billy Cobham, John Scofield and many other veteran stars of the industry have performed.
  • This is also important because we wish to showcase the contemporary Indian music to the western world.
  • The future of playing avant-garde music lies in showcasing the craft to European audience. We feel that being able to play at this festival would help us more in terms of publicity and promotion in getting more shows in and around Europe.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to help if you can not donate for the cause:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share this campaign with your folks with the share tool available on the page.

 

That'll be all.

Cheers!

Arijit Chakraborty
Band Manager
(Owner Amuze Records)
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello, we are here to seek support from the lovely people around the country India and abroad. The Bodhisattwa Trio is a Jazz influenced rock project which started as a platform for sharing life's experiences of each of the members through music. The band has gained their fame after their first Europe tour post their first album 'Intersection's release. The second album Heart of Darkness, that was released last year, was ranked by Rolling Stone as one of the top 10 Indian releases in 2016 amongst other albums from varied genres.
This year the band got an invitation from Vilnius, Lithuania to play at the prestigious Vilnius Mama Jazz Festival. The only hinderance to their travel is that the organisers are not providing with any support to the band for the international travel. Hence we seek support from whoever is kind enough to help this talented and enthusiastic bunch to reach their deserved stage at Vilnius.
It is important for all of us to go and play at that festival as 'The Bodhisattwa Trio' represents contemporary Indian music apart from Indian classical & traditional music for which we are famous. With the opportunity of this kind it will be a great occasion to showcase the modern contemporary Jazz music to the rest of the world.

What We Need & What You Get
Okay! Lets clearly break it down the exchange for you:

To go to vilnius and come back we need $3500 which includes visa and international travel expenses for the entire band.
The festival stage is slated for the band on 17th November 2017. The band however will be traveling to Europe for the month from 20th October through 20th November 2017.
It would be obvious that you would get perks and they will come in digital copies/digital prints/bromide prints of exclusive band photos and an unreleased track remixed for this project exclusively.
If we can not reach our goal then that will bring us to an uncertainty about performing at VMJF. However, if we can not at all go there, all this fund will be spent in our album recording which is slated around February 2018.


The Impact

This project is very important to us because for a band like us, getting an invitation to play at a festival of the stature of Vilnius Mama Jazz Fest is more than we can ask for. In other words, this festival is one of the top prestigious festivals of Europe where musicians like Chick Corea, Wayne Shorter, Brian Blade, John McLaughlin, Billy Cobham, John Scofield and many other veteran stars of the industry have performed.
This is also important because we wish to showcase the contemporary Indian music to the western world.
The future of playing avant-garde music lies in showcasing the craft to European audience. We feel that being able to play at this festival would help us more in terms of publicity and promotion in getting more shows in and around Europe.

 

Other Ways You Can Help
There are many ways to help if you can not donate for the cause:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Share this campaign with your folks with the share tool available on the page.

 That'll be all.Cheers!Arijit ChakrabortyBand Manager(Owner Amuze Records)

story:
Founded in 2011, under the leadership of AJ Farley (President) & Chad Elliott (Vice-President), Grayson High School’s volunteer club GIV (Grayson Interact Volunteers) hosted the first installment of the concert series entitled “Words Never Spoken,” a benefit concert in which all proceeds went to support the American Cancer Society & Relay for Life. Relay for Life is a community-lead organization that is designed to raise awareness for cancer. That concert featured artists and talents from around the Grayson community area. This time around, we’re back with the second installment, titled “Words Never Spoken: ENCORE.” As with the first concert, we are still raising money, but this time for a different, more personal cause – Lupus.

In the fall 2014, our cause became clearer than ever when AJ's mom, Pamela Farley, lost her long battle with the disease leaving us at a stand-still. The awareness of Lupus isn’t as broad as it should be and those effected are on the rise. It’s terrible to visually see people you know and love hurt and endure the pain caused by this daunting disease. Before her passing, AJ and his mom had lucrative talks about the concert, underneath the glitz and glamour of it all, she remained adamant on keeping the concert informative about the awareness of Lupus – an intent AJ and myself plan to fulfill.

Based on the response we received from the original concert, we project this one to greatly exceed the number of people who were in attendance, thus raising an even greater amount in donations.

Tentatively scheduled for May 2016, Words Never Spoken will be held at Variety Playhouse in Atlanta. Set to feature a growing constellation of artists from Atlanta. This is a benefit concert, but not all things can be donated. It is our hope to raise a minimum of $6,000 to be able to cover all of our administrative costs, including the cost of the venue, promotional materials, and security and equipment. This will allow us to donate our entire revenue from admissions and merchandise directly to the Lupus Foundation. In exchange for this support, we are offering music, merchandise, and the opportunity to celebrate life through this awesome concert. Please consider making a contribution towards this major effort in finding a cure. (Donations accepted in all amounts, not just those listed in the special boxes!)

Donations of $20 will receive a Words Never Spoken: ENCORE Event Tee & WNS Souvenir Sticker (x2), $40 and above will garner a FREE Ticket to the concert, along with the following items as the donation increases (Reference the Perks column for specifics):

  • 2EIO Presents: MORE, The Music That Inspired The Concert CD
  • Autographed Commemorative Event Poster

All donor's names will appear in a special dedication segment during the concert, categorized by amount given (please let me know if you'd like to remain anonymous). If your company would like to be an underwriter, your logo/advertisement will be given visual priority on our promotional poster. If your company would like to run an advertisement, please contact us personally as there will be separate protocol.

In considering your donation, we want you to know the facts:

  • Lupus is a chronic, autoimmune disease that can damage any part of the body (skin, joints, and/or organs inside the body). Chronic means that the signs and symptoms tend to last longer than six weeks and often for many years.
  • In Lupus, something goes wrong with your immune system, which is the part of the body that fights off viruses, bacteria, and germs ("foreign invaders," like the flu). Normally our immune system produces proteins called antibodies that protect the body from these invaders. Autoimmune means your immune system cannot tell the difference between these foreign invaders and your body’s healthy tissues ("auto" means "self") and creates autoantibodies that attack and destroy healthy tissue. These autoantibodies cause inflammation, pain, and damage in various parts of the body.
  • Lupus is also a disease of flares (the symptoms worsen and you feel ill) and remissions (the symptoms improve and you feel better). [Source]

The long-term goal for Words Never Spoken is to file for a 501(c) non-profit status by the end of 2016-early 2017. This will enable us and the board to raise money for various deserving organizations through these future concerts, and to cover all future administrative costs.

I want to take a moment to thank all the people who have already helped.  So many have shown great enthusiasm: volunteers who have approached us in getting this concert up and running, singers and musicians willing to donate their talent and time, and friends who have offered help on the administrative front.

The largest challenge this project is going to face is raising the money for the venue, as well as relying on others to fulfill their commitments. For example, if artists drop out of the show, or promotional materials aren’t completed within a specified time frame. No matter what happens, this concert will take place. We have faced many challenges producing the first concert and have learned the value of flexibility and spontaneity. 

We totally understand if you can't give big, but other ways you can make an impact include:

  • Donate your time and sign-up to Volunteer at this amazing concert
  • Help spread the word by liking our Facebook page & following us on Twitter for updates & exclusive content.
  • Sharing our Indiegogo page to your friends and family.
  • Contact us to purchase WNS merchandise: info@wnsconcert.com
  • Hashtag the cause: #TogetherWECan · #KnowLupus · #WNS

story:
Short Summary

HipHop Lives, being my first studio album, is something I have been planning for quite a while now and had to make sure I delivered something great for my fans and all hiphop lovers- actually a piece of myself. A lot of hard work has actually been input into this very album to make sure that there is something in there for everybody.
 
The album creation was motivated by the fact that I wanted to embark on a journey of my own since the record label I left had a different plan than mine concerning my career. The album is a foundation for my career in music, and what a foundation it is!
 
This album was made possible by the tremendous support of people like Ball J, Papi, Brownberry, to mention a few. It has 12 songs and features artistes like Ball J, Cabum, Teephlow, Bantuma, K. Quan and G. West, with additional vocals by J Town; and producers like Prinx iPappi,Flying Lotus,Forcefields,Oisima and Cookin' Soul.
 
The songs on the album are:
 
  1.  Intro
  2. Random Thoughts
  3. More Vim
  4. Blowing
  5. Mindstate
  6. Stay feat. Bantuma
  7. Word
  8. Hold You feat. Bantuma
  9. Zodiac
  10. HipHopLives feat. Ball J
  11. Turn Up Teephlow x K.Quan x Drilix x G.West
  12. Inferno feat. Cabum

What We Need & What You Get

A total amount of $15,000 is needed to ensure the success of this project. This project involves radio, TV and online promotions with merchandise in mostly Ghana, Nigeria and South Africa and other countries.
It also involves the shooting of music videos for almost all the tracks on the album (the video for 12. Inferno feat. Cabum has already been shot and released, and it is available on YouTube to watch).
The total amount will be divided into 5 parts of $3,000 each of which 2.5 parts ($7,500) will go to TV promotion since it entails the shooting of the videos, distribution of the videos to major TV stations and TV interviews.
One part of the remaining ($3,000) will go into Radio Promotions which involves distribution to Dj's, Presenters and Producers, and radio interviews on most major radio stations in the mentioned countries.
The remaining part ($4,500) will go into Online Promotions on YouTube, Facebook, Twitter and Google Ads; and Merchandise Production and distribution.

The Impact

My experiences as an Indie Hip Hop/Rap artist have made me realize that without proper Promotion Campaigns to push projects, they often die out at the doorstep of the studio and does not really go far as envisioned. This shows how vital Promotion Campaigns are to projects since they ensure that the projects get to the right audience conveniently as every good music is supposed to. Good music alone is not enough to ensure the success of projects without a massive push through promotions.

This is where I need your help in realizing my dream of getting my album heard by millions who yearn for good music. Your contributions will go a long way to ensuring that this album is a success by getting it heard by millions around the world.

My story is an inspiring one and so I put all of that into this album hoping to inspire young people around the world to never give up on their dreams no matter what.

This is my first crowdfunded project and I hope I hit the mark with this one. It really means a lot to me.

Risks & Challenges

This project is a challenging one since, as an Indie artist, I would have to monitor all the outlets I distribute to in order to make sure that they hold their part of the deal.

I have actually started putting together an effective management team to help me manage my career and the monitoring of the various outlets. Hopefully, this challenge will be controlled by my team and I.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute in cash, you can definitely contribute in kind! No form of contribution is too small or unimportant to me. All forms of contribution are very much appreciated and welcome by me.

In kind, you can help spread the word by sharing this project using the Indiegogo share tools; or you can tell people about the album HipHopLives by Drilix so that they go look for it online and listen.

Thank you very much for your time and consideration!

story:
If you've ever been a true fan of someone, you're familiar with the desire of getting as much as a quick glance at the reason behind your smile. We, Directioners, are all too familiar with the struggle and would do anything to see our idols. But frankly, making our dreams come true requires tickets, and tickets require money. 

This is a non-profit fundraiser for all of those who can't afford to buy tickets for the OTRAT shows. Don't worry, fam, we got your back.

What We Need & What You Get

We're raising money to buy tickets for the fans who would give everything to see their favorite band perform, but unfortunately don't have enough resources to buy a ticket on their own. Details are as follows:

  • Every donation is appreciated , whether it's $2 or $20
  • Until we raise enough money to buy the tickets, money will be saved in hands of a reliable adult.
  • If we fail to meet our goal, all the money will be returned to those who donated
  • We will take no money for ourselves, everything goes exclusivly to fans who deserve it.
  • If you can't donate- don't worry. You can still be a great help with spreading the word about the fundraiser.
Do you know anyone who deserves a ticket? Do you want one yourself? Don't be afraid to bring it to our attention!

  • You can send us an email to bringmetootrat@gmail.com.
  • You can tweet us at @tommoboner and @marie_hoult
  • If you're uncomfortable asking for tickets publicly, tweet us (@tommoboner or @marie_hoult) saying you need to talk to us in DMs.
  • Tell us about yourself/the person you want the tickets for.

What do you get? For what cost?

  • We'll buy two tickets for anyone under the age of eighteen and one ticket for anyone over the age of eighteen.
  • We'll buy the cheapest ticket avilable.
  • To make sure the tickets aren't a fraud, we'll only be purchasing them from official ticket sellers (Ticketmaster, Gigsandtours, etc.)
  • Before buying the ticket, you/your legal guardian will have an online meeting with us to make sure the tickets are going to the right hands and you will not try to make a quick profit off of them.
  • If you can not attend the concert for any reason please make sure to let us know and give another fan a chance.
  • There is no cost, the tickets are a hundred per cent free. 

Why should I donate?

Music presents a way of escape to millions of teens all over the world. Fangirls often turn to celebrities in their darkest hours, as silly as it may sound, those popstars are more often than not the reason behind their smiles. We believe every single fan deserves a chance to meet their idol, which is why we made it our goal to take as many Directioners to One Direction's On The Road Again Tour as possible. 

With donating you just might give someone a chance to meet new friends, fulfill their biggest dream, and have the time of their lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand that not everyone can donate money. Here are some other ways you can help us:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our fundraiser.
  • Spread it on Twitter, Tumblr, Facebook, every social media.
  • Try to bring it to One Direction's attention, their team and their families.
  • Tell us who you think deserves a concert ticket.

We want to say a big, big thank you to everyone who donates. We appreciate every help, big or small. Thank you for helping us turn dreams into reality.
