station s’assure de la promotion de la culture francophone, le développement
des liens entre les différentes communautés et de la  collective.
CFLX c’est une programmation musicale très variée : du jazz,
de la musique classique, de la chanson française, du blues, du country, de la
musique émergeante et d’avant garde et bien d'autres. CFLX a aussi un regard pertinent
sur  l’information, la culture, le sport,
les préoccupations sociales et les initiatives communautaires.
CFLX est diffusée avec une puissance de 1000 watts et
entendue sur la fréquence 95,5 dans un rayon  de soixante kilomètres autour de Sherbrooke, couvrant
plusieurs villes de la région estrienne dont :

Ascot Corner, Birchton, Bromptonville, Bulwer, Compton, Cookshire, Deauville, East Angus, Eaton, Fleurimont, Huntinville, Johnville, Lennoxville, Magog, Martinville, Moes River, North-Hatley, Rock Forest,Saint-Élie-d’Orford, Sherbrooke Historique:1982 - CFLX est née d’une initiative conjointe entre
l’Association générale des étudiants en génie (A.G.E.G) et l’Association
générale des étudiants en sciences (A.G.E.S.) de l’Université de Sherbrooke et
diffuse à ce moment sur la fréquence 98,1.
1984 - Le ministère des Communications accorde le
financement de la nouvelle antenne. Dans l’édifice du vieil Hôtel Magog de la rue
Dufferin à Sherbrooke débutent les travaux d’aménagement des futurs studios. Dès
l’automne, CFLX diffuse sur les ondes du 95,5.
Les années 1990 seront marquées par la détermination des nombreux
bénévoles qui ont permis à CFLX d’acquérir sa notoriété et de faire sa place
dans le paysage radiophonique régional.
Les années 2000 sont sous le signe de la relance et débute
le nouveau millénaire. CFLX confirme sa présence auprès de la communauté
estrienne.  À partir de 2007, avec Bruno Guillemette
au poste de directeur, marquera le début de plusieurs changements et une aire de
stabilité. En 2013, l’arrivée de l’homme de radio Jacques Lavoie à la direction
redonne un nouveau souffle à cette radio à saveur largement régionale.
2015 marquera donc la trentième année de diffusion sur la
fréquence 95,5. Une histoire d’amour avec les auditeurs estriens qui répondent
encore au soutien de leur radio. 
Les distinctions

PRIX ADISQ
Au cours de ses trente années d’opération, CFLX s’est vu
être nominée à plusieurs reprises pour le prix Station de radio communautaire de l’année – Marchés
central et régional  au Gala de l’ADISQ, comme ce fut le
cas en 2014.
En 1999, CFLX fut également primée par l’ADISQ pour le prix
de la publicité régionale.

PRIX ASSOCIATION DES RADIODIFFUSEURS COMMUNAUTAIRES
CFLX s’est vu récompensée plusieurs fois pour la qualité de
ses productions de  publicités locales
soit en 1992, 1994, 1996, 1997, 1998.
La vision

CFLX est soucieuse d’offrir à ses membres et à ses auditeurs
une qualité et une variété d’émissions constante et une expérience  toujours de plus en plus satisfaisante. C’est
pourquoi notre équipe est à compléter l’installation de nouveaux équipements
performants et  elle procédera au cours
de l’année à des formations spécifiques pour ses animateurs et bénévoles.

story:
UPDATE:  You can now use PayPal as a payment option!

PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE YOU READ ANYTHING ELSE!  (A little problem avoidance before we get started)

IMPORTANT NOTES:  <Shipping charges are not included in the price of the items and must be manually added by you upon check out.>  Please carefully read the Indiegogo product description to determine the shipping price for the item you are ordering, and then please add that amount to your total.  IT WILL NOT AUTOMATICALLY BE ADDED TO YOUR TOTAL, YOU MUST DO IT MANUALLY.  For example, if you order a CD ($15) and you live outside of the U.S. and Canada, your shipping price would be $8, so you would change the total checkout amount to $23.  (Each ordering option has its own set of shipping charges) 

 

T-Shirt sizes - There is no way to tell us what size of t-shirt you need on the Indiegogo order page, so just go ahead and order the t-shirt and we will contact you via email to get the size of t-shirt that you want.

 

THANKS!

About me & my Vision

I need your help to share the best and most powerfully loving music I have performed at weddings to help make a difference with my music on a larger scale:

 

I began playing guitar at the age of 9 and continued studying through University at California State Sacramento. 

I have played for audiences in excess of 1500 people as a solo artist, been promoted on the radio & even played for the congressman of California... however the majority of my career over the last decade has been spent personalizing once-in-a-lifetime moments in people's lives in just about every context imaginable but the context I have been most passionate about is weddings.

The reason why I have devoted my life to supporting weddings is because as a child my heart's greatest desire was for my family to be able to love each other and remain committed to being there for one another. At the end of high school it became very apparent that no matter how hard I tried... I was not powerful enough to fix the dysfunctional family dynamics & create a loving atmosphere to heal all that was broken. For a season of my life... being in the wrong place at the wrong time I turned to a number of things to try to run away from the pain of my family splitting apart including drugs, alcohol & other damaging lifestyle choices. After the death of my dear best friend of ten years Arthur Smith (Art) for short... I had a new perspective about the value of life a dedicated what was left of my life to service towards others through my gift of music to help bring healing and ease to others in the world... and although I was not able to re-unite my family... over the last 10 years of my life I have had the power to help support some of the most precious moments in people's lives finding & experiencing the most priceless gift... LOVE. After a decade of helping to bring literally 100's of families together with my music... I now want YOUR help to share this powerful music with a larger audience to make a difference with the music & spirit behind my mission to a larger scale. The reason why the CD is entitled "The Art of Love" ... is because... Although my friend Arthur will never get to live out anymore of his purpose in this world... I feel I can honor his life in dedicating what his friendship gave to me and his life being gone... through offering this gift of love to the world. In doing so... honor my family... honor my friend's life... honor the life I have been given... and inspire many many thousands of other people in the world have amazing support through this message and music to truly transform the pain in their lives into something so beautiful that they cannot even express the joy in words.

In supporting the creation of this studio CD... you are helping to me to share this message of courage & to make a difference on a larger scale rather than only the people's lives who are at the weddings that I perform at... but translating the power of impact to the concert stage as well as globally through making the music available world-wide through online marketing.

What I Need & What You Get

In order to make this CD a reality here are the things the money will go to:

Studio Time - Studio time can cost about $450/day and about $3,150 for a week.

$500 Mastering, $45 Copyright of Song

Many of the songs I have already written and performed, and some even recorded... however... in order to re-record the songs in studio quality their is cost involved in studio time.

In addition, their is the cost of duplication of the CD's to have available for purchase online and at my concerts/shows as I develop a tour schedule to share the music with audiences/listeners.

For online distribution of the CD I plan to make it available on iTunes, Amazon MP3, Spotify, MySpace Music, MediaNet, eMusic, Zune, Rhapsody, Nokia, Napster, Thumbplay, Amazon On Demand to help extend the audience reach and visibility.

Some of the funds will also be used to pay some supporting musicians to play with me possibly at the LIVE CD release concert which I am working on getting bids from producers such as Mary Carrera of Carrera Productions and SBL Entertainment to produce at The Harris Center, 3 Stages in Folsom, CA.

I want you to get the excitement in being involved with this project. Whether you have been a past wedding client of mine, sponsor, industry associate, personal friend, acquaintance, family member, student, fan or anyone else who has in some way been impacted by my music... I want you to feel a part of championing the cause of courageously going after fighting for the maximum amount of fulfillment & joy in your life on the other side of facing your fears. I want you to be able to experience feeling supported by me and my music as you continue to be touched by the impact I make in your life... as well as getting excited to see how me and my music will be impacting audiences and listeners to make it available to others on a larger scale.

If the full 25k is not reached, I will strip down the scale of the factors involved which will still advance the progress made in sharing the music to maximize the impact with smaller scale. Possibly use my own studio to cut cost of premium studio time... and allocate the funds to get the final product done at lower cost so as to allow for the best product at lowest cost to maximize funds to produce release concert as well as marketing and advertising.

The Impact

The impact this project can make I believe is HUGE.

There are so many people in the world who have been deeply injured in life and many of which have lost objectivity to see the hope in ever experience the hope to love and be loved at a deep heart level again.

I want to support others with my story and my music to learn to take calculated wise risks to take the leap of faith with the art of love in their lives.

Weather that looks like someone who has lost their spouse (through death or divorce) to have a healing space in the music to grieve and reconnect gently to where they can begin inviting meaningful connections into their lives again, someone who has been choosing toxic relationships due to a fear of facing the scary truth of inner challenges in loving themselves before inviting someone else to love them... or any number of other scenarios that inquire incredible courage which challenges the core of their human bravery to not just survive life... but truly experience it... for all the beauty, joy & wonderment that is possible on the other side of tragedy. 

I have a 5 star rating with each and every wedding client that I have worked with over my decade long career which is evidence of my follow through commitment to seeing this vision be realized and shared. 

I truly believe that my story and music has the power to change the world. 

I would like you to join with me in being a part of that difference made, and in doing so... feel it to continue to make a difference in your story to be courageous as you make the most of "the art of love" in YOUR life

Risks & Challenges

It is true that I have never released a studio CD before in my career or produced a CD release concert. Because of this... I have been strategically laying the groundwork to connect and collaborate the wisdom from other people in the industry with the connections... wisdom and insight to really help me to make this a success. 

I am meeting with production companies starting next week for bids on producing the CD release concert at Harris Center 3 stages and pick out a goal concert date which will fit nicely into me finishing production of this CD.

I have already begun rallying support from The Sacramento Guitar Society as well as other people who have marketing value to offer in me promoting the CD release concert once it is done to help spread the word and make it a HUGE success!

The challenge of not being a known concert artist with years of touring/selling concert tickets under my belt is something that all big house-hold names faced at some point with neysayers etc. My faith in my abilities, non-boastful but honest and valid confidence... commitment to surrounding myself with knowledgable talented people and follow through ability I believe will help me to overcome these challenges in launching my career as a concert artist.

As neysayers, see my action, & successful results... I believe I will win them over and invite them to be a part of my success and sharing my joy!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Exclusive merch for Summer 2015!

As the album shirts and "Einheitsfront" backpatches are already (or almost) sold out, it's time to think about new productions. We would like to produce polo-shirts with embroidery and new small embroidered patches with the same design as the backpatches. You can see the concept of the items below:


What can you get in this campaign?

  • Polo-Shirt with embroidery
  • Embroidered small "Einheitsfront" patch
  • "Endstation" CD
  • "Endstation" album patch
  • exclusive older Garden of Grief releases and merch
The perks have shipping costs included - please take care to choose the correct perks for YOUR location: AUSTRIA, inside the EU, WORLD (outside the EU). 


In this picture you can see the already produced items which appear in some packages: "Endstation" album patches and shirt, artwork print on wood and the already sold out backpatches. The small patches will have the same design and shape but the edge of the patch will be white instead of silver.


This is the new GARDEN OF GRIEF album "Endstation" - CD in jewelcase with a raw cardboard slipcase. 12 page booklet on raw recycling paper. Over one hour of powerful black metal!


When do I get my order?

If the campaign is successful everything takes some time to be ordered and produced. It will take at least one month to get all the needed items. Then you have to calculate some time for preparing packages and shipping. Dending on where you live you should get your orders within 2 months after the end of the campaign


Why should I back the campaign?

As it was with the album it's really easy: without enough interest it isn't possible to invest in a large amount of various merch items, it's too expensive. If you want the offered things in general, order them now while the campaign is running. Firstly, if you don't, there might be no polo-shirts at all (everyone would get their money back automatically in that case). Secondly, you can choose your preferred size and quantity - later your size might already be gone. Thirdly, you get everything cheaper (and with shipping included) than it will be after the successful campaign.


THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST & SUPPORT!

story:
This is where I decided to Start:

I wanted to start with this song when I started recording my music. It's out there in the digital realm, but before I start printing CD's, I wanted to offer these Limited, Numbered and Signed ones to you. 

Never Again...

...will these be available. My music venture starts here with something only 200 people on the planet will have.  

Will We Make It?

The goal price only covers cost of materials, and mastering the Song for CD. 'As I Lay Bleeding The Ground Reached For Me' is currently mastered for digital only. If you'd like to hear it, it's available on iTunes, Apple Play, and Spotify.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share the campaign on Facebook and wherever else you might find yourself!

story:
Origins and the Ser Artista Album Project

Orale! I am a queer Xicana singer-songwriter, guitarist, poet, composer, video documentary and music video filmmaker, and scholar. You can learn more about my work here: www.diana-alvarez.com.

While working on my PhD in Electronic Arts at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, I composed and staged Quiero Volver: A Xicanx Ritual Opera. This multimedia performance features my original music to honor the lives and work of women, non-binary and genderqueer artists of color. Quiero Volver was recognized by the press as a “visually and acoustically stunning performance” and raised over $10,000 to support immigrant justice initiatives when it was staged at the Academy of Music (Northampton, MA) in 2018.

I want to record and release my first studio album, Ser Artista to share the music from Quiero Volver: A Xicanx Ritual Opera, plus new songs from 2019 with you and with the world! My bilingual, soulful songs exalt queer love, liberation, ancestral lineage, and fiercely sing out against oppression. 

Here is what others have generously said about my work:

"The virtuosic vocal finesse of Diana Alvarez is a wonder and a privilege to behold--and no surprise to witness every audience stunned into silent awe and transcendence." -Pamela Means

"Soulful and natural." -Natalie Merchant

"Diana’s voice, her ability to shift the room by allowing her research to inform her choices of sound, song selection, and phrasing is simply remarkable. For me personally, even on YouTube - her Quiero Volver: A Xicanx Ritual Opera trailer recalibrates my mood. This is true of so many of the women of color artists before her, like Bessie Smith for example – who was said to have been able to conjure with her voice." -Sharon Bridgforth

"Diana Alvarez writes the truth through a tincture of magic and prayer, and both the spirits and the living are cupping their ears to listen." -Sean Nevin

Should you contribute to the Ser Artista album project, you will support me, a queer Xicana performer who is the first in my family to attend college (let alone pursue and earn a PhD), whose work embodies coalition building and uprooting oppression, and who is committed to building family and community through performance.

I call myself science fiction, because I am in awe of where I've ended up after growing up motherless and raised by working class familia and mentors. I figure that if I can make a PhD and music career happen coming from no money and limited resources, I can make this album happen with help from my community! In return, I will continue to create performance gatherings for QPOC, activists, and artists with amazing collaborators. 

Let's Make This Album Happen!

I have calculated that minimal costs to produce Ser Artista will be $6,000. Your funding will support the following:

  • Co-Producer Fees
  • Studio Fees (Recording, Mixing, Mastering)
  • Studio Musician Fees (Rehearsal and Recording)
  • Artwork/Graphic Design
  • CD Printing/Distribution
  • Publicity/Promotion
  • CD Release Events

***To date, I have raised over $3,500 toward this album, which will cover about half of these costs. Since there has been so much momentum around this album, I have extended the date of the campaign to make sure that more people can be in community to support this work. 

My superpower as an artist is to build up new(er) artists to own their craft. My perks for this campaign will include art work and lessons from collaborating artists who share my values, lessons and mentorship sessions with me, house concerts, birthday serenades, video editing sessions, and much more. If you are interested in supporting artists who nurture arts education and/or your own artistic journey, you've stopped at the right place.

Should I not reach my entire goal, I plan to still record and release music. I will scale down the project according to the budget. So, I might release an EP with fewer musical collaborators. Still a dream, just a more modest one. 

I Make Things Happen

Here are a few unbelievable things I've accomplished:

  • I continue to survive the early loss of my mother at age seven, plus the loss of most of my family (this has become a huge theme in my work, and why I center work around building chosen family)
  • I am the first in my family to earn a BA
  • I am the first in my family to earn an MFA in Poetry
  • I am the first in my family (and probably many families, for crying out loud) to earn a PhD in Electronic Arts
  • I composed and staged an original opera TWICE before completing my doctorate
  • Said opera raised $10,000 to support immigrant justice
  • I continue to heal, survive, create, teach, and inspire others to create art, though "We were never meant to survive" (Audre Lorde)
  • I build community for queer people of color, activists, and artists through regular performances, workshops, and fundraising events

My Ser Artista album is one way to ensure that more people will hear my music, and that I continue to perform and tour with songs of liberation, queer love, and art.

I'd be honored to have you join me on this journey.

This is Risky Business!

Pursuing art, music, and performance is risky business because although art is crucial to our survival, we live in a world that doesn't always assign it value. We are also living in challenging times, when disposable income to support independent artists is just not an option for many. 

I am invested in seeing my first studio album, Ser Artista through to its completion. Should I not meet my entire campaign goal, I will aim for a more modest recording in the form of an EP. Either way, I will create something to honor your contributions and faith in my work. 

Sing It Out, Share it With the World!

If you are unable to contribute money to this project, I understand. You can still contribute in a HUGE way by sharing this campaign (use Indiegogo share tools please) online through your various media outlets.
story_txt:
Origins and the Ser Artista Album Project
Orale! I am a queer Xicana singer-songwriter, guitarist, poet, composer, video documentary and music video filmmaker, and scholar. You can learn more about my work here: www.diana-alvarez.com.
While working on my PhD in Electronic Arts at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, I composed and staged Quiero Volver: A Xicanx Ritual Opera. This multimedia performance features my original music to honor the lives and work of women, non-binary and genderqueer artists of color. Quiero Volver was recognized by the press as a “visually and acoustically stunning performance” and raised over $10,000 to support immigrant justice initiatives when it was staged at the Academy of Music (Northampton, MA) in 2018.
I want to record and release my first studio album, Ser Artista to share the music from Quiero Volver: A Xicanx Ritual Opera, plus new songs from 2019 with you and with the world! My bilingual, soulful songs exalt queer love, liberation, ancestral lineage, and fiercely sing out against oppression. 
Here is what others have generously said about my work:
"The virtuosic vocal finesse of Diana Alvarez is a wonder and a privilege to behold--and no surprise to witness every audience stunned into silent awe and transcendence." -Pamela Means
"Soulful and natural." -Natalie Merchant
"Diana’s voice, her ability to shift the room by allowing her research to inform her choices of sound, song selection, and phrasing is simply remarkable. For me personally, even on YouTube - her Quiero Volver: A Xicanx Ritual Opera trailer recalibrates my mood. This is true of so many of the women of color artists before her, like Bessie Smith for example – who was said to have been able to conjure with her voice." -Sharon Bridgforth
"Diana Alvarez writes the truth through a tincture of magic and prayer, and both the spirits and the living are cupping their ears to listen." -Sean Nevin
Should you contribute to the Ser Artista album project, you will support me, a queer Xicana performer who is the first in my family to attend college (let alone pursue and earn a PhD), whose work embodies coalition building and uprooting oppression, and who is committed to building family and community through performance.
I call myself science fiction, because I am in awe of where I've ended up after growing up motherless and raised by working class familia and mentors. I figure that if I can make a PhD and music career happen coming from no money and limited resources, I can make this album happen with help from my community! In return, I will continue to create performance gatherings for QPOC, activists, and artists with amazing collaborators. 
Let's Make This Album Happen!
I have calculated that minimal costs to produce Ser Artista will be $6,000. Your funding will support the following:

Co-Producer Fees
Studio Fees (Recording, Mixing, Mastering)
Studio Musician Fees (Rehearsal and Recording)
Artwork/Graphic Design
CD Printing/Distribution
Publicity/Promotion
CD Release Events

***To date, I have raised over $3,500 toward this album, which will cover about half of these costs. Since there has been so much momentum around this album, I have extended the date of the campaign to make sure that more people can be in community to support this work. 
My superpower as an artist is to build up new(er) artists to own their craft. My perks for this campaign will include art work and lessons from collaborating artists who share my values, lessons and mentorship sessions with me, house concerts, birthday serenades, video editing sessions, and much more. If you are interested in supporting artists who nurture arts education and/or your own artistic journey, you've stopped at the right place.
Should I not reach my entire goal, I plan to still record and release music. I will scale down the project according to the budget. So, I might release an EP with fewer musical collaborators. Still a dream, just a more modest one. 
I Make Things Happen
Here are a few unbelievable things I've accomplished:

I continue to survive the early loss of my mother at age seven, plus the loss of most of my family (this has become a huge theme in my work, and why I center work around building chosen family)
I am the first in my family to earn a BA
I am the first in my family to earn an MFA in Poetry
I am the first in my family (and probably many families, for crying out loud) to earn a PhD in Electronic Arts
I composed and staged an original opera TWICE before completing my doctorate
Said opera raised $10,000 to support immigrant justice
I continue to heal, survive, create, teach, and inspire others to create art, though "We were never meant to survive" (Audre Lorde)
I build community for queer people of color, activists, and artists through regular performances, workshops, and fundraising events

My Ser Artista album is one way to ensure that more people will hear my music, and that I continue to perform and tour with songs of liberation, queer love, and art.
I'd be honored to have you join me on this journey.
This is Risky Business!
Pursuing art, music, and performance is risky business because although art is crucial to our survival, we live in a world that doesn't always assign it value. We are also living in challenging times, when disposable income to support independent artists is just not an option for many. 
I am invested in seeing my first studio album, Ser Artista through to its completion. Should I not meet my entire campaign goal, I will aim for a more modest recording in the form of an EP. Either way, I will create something to honor your contributions and faith in my work. 
Sing It Out, Share it With the World!
If you are unable to contribute money to this project, I understand. You can still contribute in a HUGE way by sharing this campaign (use Indiegogo share tools please) online through your various media outlets.

story:
Short Summary

We're a family of 7 living in Jeffrey’s Bay. Passionate about people, music, surfing & travel and 
spreading hope with our songs and our story!

We have been married for 16 years and have 5 amazing children.

We were both born in the same hospital, lived in the same town and across the road from each other, went to the same school yet only met years later in Jeffreys Bay at Victory Gap year at the ages of 18 and 22.  And like one of our songs says "Our roads crossed throughout our childhoods but we never knew, cos Father loves to hide things for us until the time is due."  We can only look back in awe of the journey we have been on together in the community and church that He has placed us in.

 

The songs on this album are snippets from the journey.  Our stories set to song. Some were written in a season of pain and frustration, while others come from a deep understanding that there is no growth without process.  Come lend your ears and hearts from and hopefully you to will be encouraged and enriched by the lyrics and melodies that flow from these songs.

The reason for this campaign, is to get our latest album out to our friends abroad.  We know some of you would love to be here but distance is a good excuse and so we want to include you into this experience by giving you the opportunity to get your hands on the TIME album and merchandise.  We can't make this sort of thing happen without funding and so we are creating a platform that enables your support and input.

 

What will you get for giving?

We are making different products available for you to choose from such as:

- A signed copy of the EP album

- Wondering Watson's caps and other merchandise that will be available

 

The Impact

We believe that music can have a powerful effect on people's lives.  Our songs are messages of hope in seasons of doubt and frustration.  We wish to share this with others as we know that it will inspire others to see the hope that we live by.

We are also aiming to give proceeds from the launch to Healthy Mom and Baby Clinic run by powerhouse friend Margreet Wibbelink.

Find out more details about this at:  

http://www.hmbc.co.za

https://www.facebook.com/TheSurfingMidwife
 

Risks & Challenges

For many years we have tried to record songs but the timing has never been right.  Now that season has come of age and thanks to our friends and family we have been able to make this dream a reality.  

Recording

The album was recorded by Kurt Slabbert at BlueNoise Production's with the help of Bob Thorpe here in Jeffrey's Bay and so by raising funds for this launch you will enable us to do something special to give back to these amazing people.

Venue

The venue where we are launching the album will need some decor, sound and lighting and other items.  Your contribution will make the evening extra special.

Printing and Distribution of the Album

Just when you think that the album is done you are faced with the dilemma of actually getting the music into your hands.  Your funding will help us design, print, burn and distribute the album.

 

Other ways to help other than giving.

We understand that not everyone can afford to give.  All that we ask is that, if you like our sound, then please inform others of what we are doing.

Lots of love from  Brandon and Mandy Watson

story:
ABOUT ME

I am a Los Angeles-based singer, songwriter, recording and performance artist, producer and director of live performance and video. I’ve been a lifelong Artist but burst onto the music scene in 2013, finally in pursuit of my dream to be a SupaStar entertainer who empowers the LGBTQ community, People of Color, Women and Girls, globally. I have since released an EP, several singles, music videos, and wowed audiences from San Francisco to Sydney Australia.

Over the last 12 years, I’ve experienced a profound renaissance as a Black, Queer, Woman, Activist and Artist. And now at a high point in my journey, I am ready to share my experiences with you through my sophomore EP, Reborn, to be released in late fall 2019. The EP will examine such themes as Sexual Revolution, Relationship Trauma, Loss of Loves/Death and the Healing Power of Music & Dance. Reborn will also showcase my evolution as an Artist with new sounds and persona, that authentically reflect my creative expression today.

My brilliant, long-time music partner, Hermann Unterwurzacher, will compose the music for the majority of the songs on Reborn. And I’m extremely excited to have Korynn OC, a very talented singer and songwriter, co-write one of my favorite songs on the EP, I Love You (I’m Gon’ Leave You). It’s sooooo good! Check out this video for Dangerous, the very first single I released to get a taste of my sound 6 years ago. I’ve evolved so much since then, can’t wait for you to hear!

 

WHAT I NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Real talk?! Records cost money to make. I know, right?!?! I have to pay musician fees, producer fees, recording studio time, mixing, mastering, packaging/replication, promotion, album artwork and distribution. In addition, Indiegogo fees (9%) and payment transaction fees (5%) will be charged. Otherwise, every dollar raised will go into the creation and release of Reborn. Of course, I don't have a record label footing the bill. I’m an independent artist, and I really do NEED YOUR HELP to bring this baby to life. Indiegogo is an amazing platform for artists like me and SupaStars like you, because it bridges the gap between us. No middle person. Just us. We get to do something magical, TOGETHER! We get to give birth to Reborn.

In return for your contribution to this campaign, I have some great PERKS lined-up including autographed CDs, T-shirts, VIP tickets to the CD release party, private concerts, recording studio sit-ins and more!

WHAT ELSE YOU NEED TO KNOW

It's important for you to know that with this campaign, it's ALL OR NOTHING. If I don't reach my goal, I don't get a dime. But, I have faith in YOU, in US! I know we can do this! It WILL HAPPEN. I am so ready to share Reborn with you and introduce you to the sounds and essence of Vero. Please contribute to my Indiegogo campaign and share this link with others.

If we reach the goal, I'll be able to make the EP. If we exceed the goal, I’ll be able to work with my dream producer, industry veteran, Big Chris Flores. He produced my last two singles, Tightrope and MothaF**ka! I'm excited that I was able to save up enough to at least have him produce the first single off the EP called I Love You. To have him produce my entire EP would be a dream come true, and elevate my music to a whole nother level. If we exceed-exceed the goal, I’ll also be able to produce music videos for 4 of the songs on the EP. I have the visual treatments and video producers ready to go.

If you aren’t able to contribute at this time, don’t fret! Just help SPREAD THE WORD! Indiegogo makes it really easy for you to share via social media and email.

With love and gratitude…

Vixen Noir

story:
Short Summary

My name is Connor Roy. I'm a Singer-Songwriter and Worship Leader from Detroit, MI. I have been playing guitar since second grade and writing songs since the age of 12. I released my very first full-length album in 2014 and feel the time is right to work on my second full-length album! I've created this campaign to get people involved in the process! 

What I Need & What You Get

As you might know, a full-length album can be very costly. I'm reaching out to you for help in this process. You'll be a major part of getting this project off the ground! I'm asking for $5,000 to put towards this project. The money will go towards studio time, production costs, and graphic design. If I raise more than the specified amount, I can put that towards merch and other fun stuff for all of the supporters! Some of the perks I'll be offering will be an opportunity to sit in on a studio session and check out what my producer and I do behind the scenes! I'll also be offering exclusive merch items such as an autographed poster, my entire discography on CDs (including the new album when it is released), as well as a shirt exclusively made for those who support the campaign!

The Impact

This is a project that God has laid on my heart. My prayer is that each song would speak to someone's heart and that through this project people would come to know Jesus in a real way! You can help be a part of sending this message out by making a contribution. Jesus said to go into all the world and preach the Gospel and music is simply the vehicle that I use to do that. I'm extremely passionate about what I do so each project is special and unique. Each project has a special place in my heart. Please consider making a contribution in addition to praying for this project and all of those who would hear it

Risks & Challenges

While there is always a risk of not raising the full amount, the money raised through this campaign will be put towards this project nonetheless. God continues to provide for each project and I anticipate that He will provide for this one as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a financial contribution, please pray for this project. Prayers are the most important thing! Secondly, if you could share this project with friends, family, co-workers, or anyone with access to the internet, I would greatly appreciate it! If just 500 people donated $10, that equals $5,000. I have over 1,000 friends on Facebook so 500 people is just a small chunk of that.

story:
How Does It Sound?

My blurry dreamscape turned to clarity.

And you can listen here! https://soundcloud.com/babuoji/sets/oraffra/s-VNSe7

Most people like track 3 cause it's a bop, but my personal favorite is track 4.

Who Is Babu Oji?

I am Babu Oji. I am a Hindu & Buddhist. I've been producing music for myself for about 8 years now, prior to that I KNEW I could not make music. I knew that. We know a lot of things. And then we get new things to know. My music is not about unlearning nor learning. It's about heart. And it's about healing. It's about emotion, and dealing. Please join me as I take you through my spiritual pursuit, and find reflections and commonalities that ground you in yours.

Where Will The Funds Go?

Parts. I need parts. Computer parts. My gear is jank and it doesn't wanna fly with much. Producing, mixing, mastering, these take a lot out of a computer. And mine can't really handle it.

Risks?

I've been making music for a long time, so finishing the project when I have the right gear is no real worry. But I am at the risk of being homeless. I've been looking into federal jobs via Application A (Help for the Disabled), so this risk should be minimized soon.

Please Help Get The Word Out

Babu Oji is here. Please help make me here to stay.

Follow me on twitter @ https://twitter.com/OjiBabu and please buy my audiotapes.

story:
Short Summary

We are forming a Disciple Music app which will provide exclusively Christian music. This will allow you to:

  • Easily discover more Christian music.
  • Find custom and curated playlists centered around Christian music and building a better worship expereince. 

What We Need & What You Get

This is exactly where your money is going

  • We need ___ in order to access popular artists like Hillsong United, Lauren Daigle, etc.
  • You will be paying for your subscription to Disciple Music in different lengths. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Follow us on Instagram or Facebook.
  • Or you can share this link for other people to get involved.
